i recommend reading the textbook and going to tutorial

Cosman doesn't teach, lectures are practically just optional discussion sections that only 10% of students actually go to. I used the lecture notes to learn the content, they were alright and got the job done but all learning is done outside of class. Cosman clearly sees feedback about the class format but doesn't seem willing to change anything..
The class materials aren't bad but the flipped classroom format sucks. Going to classes is pretty much worthless. Otherwise, not too hard to get a good grade in if you put in the work

cosman doesn't teach but no one goes to discussion so it's not like it would make a difference if he did. you can learn everything you need from the textbook, lecture notes, and past examlets anyways. cs 173 is not hard if you read the textbook, lecture notes maybe, do the study problems, and practice with past examlets. form a strong study group!!

Avoid this prof if you can. He does not even teach at all, you just have access to videos from Spring 2021 from a completely different professor. Everything is online and the funny thing is the homework assignments only worth 5% of your grade. The class has a bunch of TAs so I don't know why this prof is getting paid, nor why he is even a teacher.
This class is so awful

This dude doesn't even teach. The whole class is watching these videos by a different professor made like 2 years ago and reading a textbook. This dud could be replaced with a random person who knows nothing about cs and the class would be the exact same.

This professor does not do his job. The only "lectures" available are video lectures from a completely separate professor from 2021. Prepare to teach yourself the entire semester by reading an online textbook. Office hours can be helpful for some. Considering that the "examlets" (essentially quizzes) are worth 90% of your entire grade, study up.
What hell is going on after induction???????????????????????????????????????

The concepts that occur in the homework have never been talked about in the givin material and lecture video. You have to teach yourself even in class. Moreover, there are 7 quizs and 1 final that worth 90% percent of this course.
My motto is to count this cash

If you don't go to office hours which is 95% of the people taking this course. Good luck, you're not gonna have fun reading the textbook. Lectures are non-existent, which means you gotta learn yourself. Tests are now 90% btw. :)
Very clear about the coursework and the criteria. Fair grading and the a good amount of homework to keep up with the material. Not overwhelming.
Very knowledgeable of the course content and made it very easy to get help for the course content outside of class

Actually, not bad, I thought it would be quite bad, but I think I survived it well. I really liked the professor, he explained concepts very well, especially when you spoke to him during Office Hours. Would definitely take him again.

This class is poorly structured, 80% purely exams with 8% homework that's based on accuracy and the professor basically do nothing in term of lecturing or teaching the material. Take it somewhere else and have it transfer in as 173 credit :\

Don't take this class unless you have to, with any prof. It is a major time commitment and all of it is self-learning, so if you are genuinely interested in the concepts, just learn it on your own and its the same thing except without grades.
CS 173 is badly structured and I wish there were more practice problems.
I took the course last semester and he taught it well. Even though the course was mainly watching online lectures, he does explain the concepts really well, especially if you're stuck on a problem.
80% testing is crazy

The majority of negative reviews on Cosman are because of the format of CS 173. Yes, the class has a comedically poor structure. However, Professor Cosman is very helpful at explaining topics in office hours (and even more by individual meeting requests).
Doesn't teach, kinda a waste of time and money
tough class, but nice guy.
Is not an actual teacher, I do not even know what his job is.
You'd think he never taught in his life.

Man doesnt know how to teach and the grading scale is actually messed up it feels like a 9th grader made it. 80 percent of your grade is quizzes but wait theres more. The homework is basically a weekly test because theres no retaking problems. So even if you misclick theres points gone. The homework is 8 percent so 88 percent is basically tests. HF
Terrible class format. Terrible communication if any. Take another professor if possible.
Try someone else.

Lectures are "flipped", meaning you watch videos at home and do group work in class. I like this system, as it allowed me to practice what I learned. The weekly examlets were somewhat difficult and I disliked their multiple choice format.
Passionate about material and passionate about teaching students the material. Cares more about understanding the content than test grades.
Really good professor who is extremely passionate about the material. Didn't think I would care about ethics but ended up learning a lot.
One of the best professors that I had. Learned A LOT from his class, really sparked my interest in technology. Grading isn't that hard at all if you pay attention and actually want to learn.
He's an interesting and inspiring lecturer who leaves a tad to be desired and overall I completely recommend him for any cs courses.

If you are not CS major get ready to die. At the beginning class(101)seems easy, but when you get your first homework where you should write whole code by yourself , that's madness. However, midterms are not so bad , but the final is tough because there are free-response  questions.
Good teacher, but the homeworks are a little tough, especially if you are not a CS major. Would suggest utilizing TA office hours, and befriending people!

Very condescending. Answers Piazza posts in a very disrespectful way. Gets really mad when people don't attend lecture so he makes the tests really hard which doesn't benefit anyone. Kind of acts like a child when it comes to people not paying attention to exactly what he expects. Needs to grow up a little bit.
He wanted his students to succeed. He's a great professor that really wants everyone to succeed.

He's a very intelligent, young guy who is very clear, cares about his students, and honestly seems like the most personable professor I've ever had while on campus. I've had him three times, and I recommend him to any student taking any computer science oriented courses. He knows his stuff.
One of the best Professors I've ever had. Very nice and helpful. Lectures are engaging and clear.
He's a really nice professor but his class is not very useful.
There is no help in this class. The class is not structured properly and unnecessarily stressful. Learned absolutely nothing from this class.

Professor Woodley is great at communicating if you reach out to him, but the structure of CS 126 has been frustrating. The grading rubric is incredibly subjective and the only solution is to email your code moderator with every step. There is no time between projects and we aren't taught the material necessary to complete them.
Lectures are merely a quick recap of the readings, he don't go into detail at all. The lectures themselves are not particularly useful.

Very hands off, delegating way too much responsibility to the course staff, who were generally unhelpful and did an awful job designing the assignments. His lectures are fine and the class isn't too difficult if you put in the required time, but the way that he runs the course vastly overcomplicates what should be an incredibly easy class.

Lectures were barely helpful during the first month of class. I stopped attending after they continued to be that way. Didn't bother to watch any of them later nor did I need to. I ended up having to use a ton of outside sources to work on my weekly projects. After 6 weeks, we switched from Java to C++. Pretty much expected to learn C++ overnight.

He never responds to emails and solely trusts senior staff and your grader to deal with your issues. He was often distracted during lectures and many times came with broken code. This made lecture even more confusing than it needed to be. Most people only came for iClicker points...

terrible prof, doesnt do anything in lectures, the TA's do all the work and theyre very bad at communication. dont teach you how to code at all, documentation for MP's are often wrong/not helpful. office hours havent helped at all. feel bad for any future students since unfortunately cs 126 is mandatory for cs majors.

The class would function better without the professor. The projects were created by the former instructor. Woodley's lectures are rambling nonsense and are mainly about himself - you have to learn everything on your own. If you are assigned a tough code mod, you will get the same grade as someone who put in much less work but had a lenient grader.

While people are talking about grading, it's his lectures that are his weakest. It's very unorganized and he would just talk for half an hour about random stories, which are rarely helpful. This semester, he realized that nobody cares about his lectures so he had to start doing iClicker to force students to come in.
Great lectures!
Best professor in UIUC!

Extremely unfair grading. What grade you get totally depends on if your section TA likes you or not. You might do much more than other students in your section but get a lower grade than them. It's a joke they say you can argue about that, because you know if you ever argue with the TA he/she will be more picky about you next time.
I loved the lectures. The assignments were also very practical and taught me a lot. Well-planned and organized course. I highly recommend this to any CS major that wants to enter industry.
He is an amazing lecturer. Sad that this is the only class that he teaches. I hope he teaches more classes.
My friend in another discussion section got the same grade as I did (did all requirements) for just showing up in the discussion. :))))))))))))
Fake extra credit, students beware.

Lectures are a joke, he reads off the outdated course website and tells anecdotes. Grading and Piazza are 100% handled by the TAs. Your only actual teacher in this class is StackOverflow, since even the documentation the class provides in insufficient. Professor is a complete non-factor in this class, be ready to learn a lot of code on your own.

There's no actual grade normalization. This means that you get whatever grade your moderator gives you, which means certain moderators will definitely give you a higher grade and you don't get to pick.
He didn't keep up with what was previously mentioned. Way too much subjectivity and no actual normalization.
Keeps lectures short and realizes if he doesn't have anything else to say. Casual attitude in class which was enjoyable.
Class is hard, but really approachable since professor is mainly looking for your attitude towards this class. Strongly recommanded

Genuinely a good lecturer who makes concepts understandable and leads a well-supported course. There's a very useful Discord, interesting and challenging MPs, and I feel he really does care about the success of his students. There is a lot of work though: bi-weekly MPs, CBTF exams, and weekly lab sections that feel like mini MPs.

CS225 is not a hard course. MPs are a little time consuming, but there is 10 percentage points of extra credit. Quizzes are very similar to practice tests. Brad Solomon is clearly a professor passionate about CS, but most of the lectures are not too relevant, and seem a little bit rambly. You can get most content with lec slides saving time.

The best I can say is he's a good lecturer. I found the structure of his class to be entirely too demanding and too reliant on code in a class that at least by its description seems that it should have some graded component related to theory. Exams are unfair and limited staff means many students are left behind. He favors high performing students.

He is 'ok' in terms of like speaking clearly. However, for a cs class thats just not enough. He speaks without any variation in tone, making it difficult to grasp the important points of concepts. Moreover, unlike Evans, he just keeps 'stating facts' when teaching and saying 'whats the xx for xx? well thats xx'. Not feeling inspirational at all.

The class is very test heavy, and Professor Solomon has been making the class harder compared to previous semesters, for instance, the course now has a mandatory final exam and the final project is completely a project of your choice (which he is then much more likely to reject because of staff availability).

Like many of the 100-200-Level CS courses, CS 225's struggles come from having so many students taking the course each semester. However, Professor Solomon in a great person if you attend his office hour.

There's not any point going to lecture, you'd be much better off studying the material from YouTube videos. The exams have different levels of difficulty depending on which prompt the system gives you and if you ever ask him for help or a reassessment of an assignment score, good luck getting him to reply to you.
Overall, great course. I also took him for the honors section. He gives nice lectures and is very communicative.
Took CS 225 and CS 225 Honors, loved his lectures, great professor.

CS225 Honor is a great course by Mr. Solomon (sad he won't teach honor next semester but do take his CS225! It will be fantastic). He explains the string algorithms in a really organized, understandable, and fun way. The homework require a little bit of thinking but you will do well if you absorb the stuffs in lecture.
He's a great professor and I really enjoy his classes, would definitely recommend.
Such a nice guy teaching a great course! Would take again if i could.
The assignments were interesting. The lecture content was dense and hard to grasp at times but I appreciate that he made time to adjust the class based on student feedback.

Lectures were not useful. He barely taught the class in lecture and the slides are nearly all blank so you cannot find filled-in notes anywhere. Exam outlines were posted late which made it difficult to not have to cram in studying.

my favorite class thus far in the CS curriculum. 233 is extremely well designed compared to other CS classes, although it is a ton of work, be prepared for that (6 assignments/labs a week). even coming in with little knowledge about hardware you'll learn a ton, and the course staff do everything they can to decrease stress as much as possible
Herman was always nice, understanding, and flexible. 233 was my favorite class during my Computer Science undergrad.

Prof Herman is the BEST professor you can ever get. He cares about his student and knows the stuff his teaching.

The class is so well structured and offers very comprehensive lectures and video tutorials for most of the questions plus he walks you through some of those difficult question types before the actual quiz.
Made a boring class fun. Best made course ever, an expert in education.

The course has many moving parts, but Prof Herman keeps everything clear and on track. He has structured the course exceptionally well, building simple concept upon simple concept until you look back and realise how far you've come. There are few professors as caring and accessible as he is, and I would gladly take any course he decides to run.

He cares a lot for students! Every exam has 2nd chance. There are plenty of extra credits, and final weighs only 10%. The course is interesting (cuz I am a great fan of computer architecture, but anyway, you will learn A LOT), and the concepts are generally not too difficult. You should spend more time learning stash, cache, and conscious coding.
Very good professor, really knows his stuff
Amazing professor, he really knows the content in and out and actually cares about the students. Definitely made a boring class fun!

Prof. Herman is a great person and instructor. The course material isn't easy, but he gives you lots of opportunities for extra credit and often grants extensions when the whole class is struggling. You can tell he cares about his students. Plus he knows his material in and out. Overall very well structured and organized class.

The course content could be better taught. Prelecture small clips are super good but under explained sometimes so the GAs and labs can become stressful. Class induces unnecessary stress that can be avoided if the content is taught better. But the class is very very well run otherwise. Other classes at this school should learn from professor Herman

The class is organized and run very well, other professors could learn a thing or two from Professor Herman. The content itself is difficult and the labs + GAs are stressful, but that is true for all all large coding projects. If you can complete every assignment by yourself you will do fine in the course, and there is a lot of EC if you can't.
His presence didn't make a class where I hated every second of the content worse. This is just one of those classes that I had to drag through.

Class structure was very organized and facilitated learning very well, truly one of the best. The lectures were usually solid, and the group work provided great practice for the quizzes. Overall, as long as you do all the work recommended by the prof (which isn't that much) you are guaranteed an A.
The class sucks but I think it's unavoidable given the subject matter. Prof is interesting and smart, and there's a lot of ec and stuff to help your grade.

Really fun professor and a good lecturer. There's a LOT of work in this class but it's clear what you need to study for and TAs and professors are really helpful. The material is really fun and engaging.

If you have never taken a hardware class don't think of skipping the videos he uploads. He goes over things very well but sometimes he just skips over topics to save time which is why I rated a 4/5. This class is a grind so be ready for that

Love his bite-sized condensed lecture videos. He went the extra mile by creating 1-2 hr long quiz review videos and other briefings which were super helpful, and even makes other videos on demand. Tons of practice to understand the material and I learned a great deal. Impeccable course structure, organized, and he was communicative over Campuswire.

Even though I struggled a bit in his class, Professor Herman was a very good professor at UIUC. He gave a lot of practice problems to help understand the concepts and even offers videos to watch to help understand the concepts. In fact, he adjusts accordingly according to feedback and always there for his students to succeed.

This class is the best taught CS class I've taken at this school. Very difficult topics were broken down into digestible 5 min videos followed by questions to reinforce learning. Wish every class was taught like this, can't handle 50 min lectures with unrelated homework anymore. Professor Herman really spoiled us.

Professor Herman is one of the most incredible CS professors I've met so far. He does a great job of teaching content (which by no means is easy content to teach) and does a lot to alleviate student stress. He gives many opportunities for students to get extra points and continuously listens to feedback and adjusts his class accordingly.

Nice and helpful. Active on Piazza. Seemed fair and flexible. Lectures and homeworks prepared you for exams. Assignments were managable. However, for many exams, I felt like I was more drilling specific types of problems than learning concepts.
a good lecturer and overall the class is run very well. he gives you the option to opt out of lecture but i wouldnt, you get ec for participating and it will make it so much easier to learn i promise

Computer Architecture is not easy. Prof Herman makes it explicit and undertandable. There are pre-flight videos and some conceptional questions before lectures so make use of these , lectures are clear and efficient, hw are well designed definitely do it. If you done the above, exams will be OK. Labs are time consuming, start early.

Professor Herman was the best professor I had the semester I took that class. The class has a steep curve in terms of the material, but he explains everything really well, has review sessions and great exam tips. Also, he kept taking feedback about all sorts of things throughout the semester, and immediately acted on them.

He is a solid lecturer and is someone you would be glad to talk with. The exams are reasonable, but exam 6 is much harder than all the rest. Start the labs early and attend the lectures and discussions for free points. The labs vary in difficulty. The class teaches useful material.

Professor Herman is a good instructor even though occasionally he did not explain the material very clear. Self-teaching matters A LOT in this class, and be careful that this class gets harder before you realize it.
He defines me. Never mind.
He definitely cares about the students, but sometimes the lectures can be boring
He really cares about students. Responds to emails quickly. Very clear lectures. Great Prof.
Professor Herman is Great. The lectures are clear, and the online mini clips are great. Easy to understand, and the best teaching quality ever.
Awesome teacher, too good to be true. Enthusiastic, happy and knows his material well. Will gladly take another class with the dude
GG always re. Herman best professor NA.

He is super enthusiastic, and will go over everything very clearly. If you have questions however, it is best to go to office hours because if you ask during class he just sort of repeats what he just said. At office hours he is fantastic. Just a super nice guy overall! Hard course though...

Students cant understand full circuit design unless their homeworks deal with more fundamental simple design concepts. Grades are important  so challenging problems on graded homeworks with less time to figure them out debilitate confidence if there is no corresponding support provided in teaching. Can improve course structure greatly.
Great prof. Too bad he is not here all the time.

Professor Herman's version of ECE290 is exciting and educational, giving us the chance to get into team based learning at the sophomore level. He's a very enthusiastic lecturer as well, definitely would recommend taking 290 with him if you can.

I've had Ryan for Bio 190 and 223, and I would take every science class with him if possible. I don't think getting anything but an A in his class is possible. He reviews the exams with the class so you know exactly what to expect. He is so understanding and accommodating and makes his lectures easy to follow!

IF YOU CAN TAKE RYAN DO IT! Ryan is one of the most caring professors I've had in my 4 years in college! He provides YouTube videos, study guides, and teaches the material in very understandable ways. He is also very approachable if you have any questions! I had to take this class 7-9:50pm and I never dreaded going because he made it fun!

Take this class for 223! Ryan has youtube videos, in class lectures, and provides packets to study from. I watched the videos, went to lab, and filled out the packets and found that the materials on the practicals (exams) reflect what was covered. He's also really approachable and talks about medical topics in lab. Fun class!

Ryan is the BEST. I wish I could have him as a teacher for every science class I need for my degree. He's funny, caring, and will take the time to make sure you understand the material, super fair/easy grader, and there are a couple of extra credit opportunities. I had just over 100% in the class before the final and practical. He's great!

Such a great professor! He really knows how to keep the class engaged. He made sure everyone understood the material and was quick to help anyone who was struggling. It's refreshing to have a professor feel like they really care about the subject and the students! Definitely take one of his classes if you ever get the chance!
Ryan was such an amazing instructor. His class is hard not to pass because he's great at explaining things and he is willing to give you more than one chance if needed. Loved his class!
He really cares about all his students being successful.

Ryan was an awesome professor and very approachable. He was always available during class for any questions during the lab and was always willing to meet outside of class if you were struggling. Most of the class is done with your lab group and it was honestly a really fun class
Really cool teacher , very easy

Great professor. I failed this class the semester before and was worried about taking it a second time. Ryan was the best professor and I would take him for several other science classes. He explains everything in just enough detail making it easy to understand. His grading is fair and he gives opportunity for you to succeed in his class.
He is the best biology professor ever!!! Homework every week, but it really helps a lot for the final. I hope he teaches other biology classes, too.

I'm in Ryan's class this Fall Semester. He takes his time going through difficult concepts and tries to break them down so it's easier to understand. He also teaches different methods and ways to do things. We get a lot of take home quizzes but they were helpful in learning the calculations. I had a lot of fun with my lab group and the lab!

RYAN IS THE FREAKING BEST DUDE. DONT LOOK FURTHER DOWN THAN THIS COMMENT-HE IS THE BEST. and this is coming from a class i was forced to take on FRIDAYS. he helped me find my study style! ryan is so helpful, funny, smart, all the above man. thank you ryan if u read this. a blessing lol
the rumors are true! He's the best!

LITERALLY BEST EVER! Very to the point, you know what is due when and it is an overall super easy A. You get 1 page front and back for EACH part of the 2 part final. He is always available for help and just a fun, down to earth teacher. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! (:

Incredible Professor that is highly respected, yet very fun.  He teaches you as much as he can and lets you enjoy the process of learning while at it.  I would highly recommend taking Ryan and wish he taught more than just 190L.  Would love to see him in A&P or Micro.

Ryan was by far the best professor I've ever had. It doesn't matter what your learning style is because he can appeal to everyone!! He is extremely willing to help his students as much as they need and no one has ever taught me how to use a microscope as well as him.

I loved this class. I was lucky enough to be in an awesome group for my labs, but Ryan was just so clear-cut and helpful and funny. Just learn your math, know your labs and you're good to go. I wish he was my lab instructor for every lab I take! He's so helpful and he's always ready to help his students! You would have to try to fail this class.
Great professor that is very helpful for his students. I absolutely recommend this professor!!

I got very lucky by getting Ryan as a lab instructor while I had a horrid experience with the adjoining lecture instructor. Did everything he could to help  and made sure you felt comfortable with the experiments you were completing. I ran into him 2 years after taking his class, and he gave me notes for my current BIO class. A++++++

I sincerely hate biology. I loved every minute of Ryans class. He is fun, helpful and kind. Take him while you can, he wants, and will be, an excellent doctor someday. He prints out textbook for his students, so no need to buy one. Wonderful teacher.

Ryan is HANDS DOWN the best professor that I've ever had!  He cares about his students understanding the material and is the most patient teacher I've ever encountered.  He knows how to joke with his students, but also knows how to buckle down and teach.  Seriously, do yourself the biggest favor and sign up for Ryan's class!

PLEASE do yourself a favor and take Ryan! He is officially one of the BEST professors I've had at TMCC! Class is mandatory but he makes it fun, you can use your notes on the quizzes, he is ALWAYS willing to help, e-mails you back super quickly (sometimes the same day, even at midnight lol), super easy going and professional. Seriously, take my word

Ryan is amazing! He goes above and beyond making sure his students understand and excel in his class. Ryan easily spends additional time (his own) to be available for his students. I doubt I will ever experience another class with an instructor as fabulous as Ryan. I am sad this class is almost done.

Ryan was amazing! Truly cares about his students succeeding. Clear labs and he loves to help. Offers small portions of extra credit throughout class. Tons of open labs for help. Would highly recommend taking
Ryan is so amazing!! Truly cares about his students learning the material and getting a good grade!
This class is dependent on how hard you try and the effort put in; Ryan is super helpful and the labs were fun. I recommend taking his class!
Ryan is an awesome lab instructor! He makes a long class fun and helps students understand concepts. He wants everyone to excel and pass.
Really fun lab, learned a lot, he really cares about his students and simplifies complex concepts really well. I definitely enjoyed the lab!
Take this class. The course work isn't too difficult and isn't too easy it's just about right. He's also always willing to help. Extra credit opportunities too.

Anyone that is complaining on here is a snowflake. This is a GREAT class, well organized, lots of TAs, helpful professor who really wants us to learn. The class is very organized!  This is not an 'easy A'. I have so much praise and respect for the prof I can't say enough good things. He is respectful as long as you are trying and respectful back.

I could not recommend enough to take STAT 385 with another professor if possible. In my experience, Dave produced a classroom community that felt incredibly unwelcoming. This was done by his consistent rude tone in answering questions, as well as making students feel stupid for potentially missing bits of information from videos or the website.

Very active on the Ed forum so if you ask a question he responds very quickly. Quizzes, labs, exams are very easy. Lectures are always interesting too! Try the in-person section if you can. 

The final project (creating your own Shiny app) is also very fun! Would highly recommend this class

The class website is easy to navigate and the syllabus is straightforward. The professor is also quite snarky when responding to students in the forum. His responses are not very helpful at all, just extremely rude and insensitive. Overall, the class is fine and grading is fair, the professor on the other hand is questionable.

The professor doesn't give any example problems. He does not go into the details but expects you to solve the homework which requires detailed approach. He leaves certain topics to self read which are not at all easy and shouldn't be left as an exercise.

this class is ridiculously easy. there's one midterm and no final and i didn't even study for the midterm and finished it in 14 minutes and got a 99.9%. homework is simple and you have a lot of time to work on it. professor has very helpful lecture videos and he is very funny.

Very clear, very direct. Not only do I feel as though he actually taught me the concepts of the class, he also goes into great detail about R. Whenever he encounters an error himself in the lecture he'll spend some time going through exactly why it occurred. Fantastic professor, I will be looking for his name when choosing future courses.

I would say that David is the BEST STATS teacher at UIUC. His STAT 432 is a really helpful class. He wrote the machine learning materials and prepared lots of good examples for homework assignments. If you have some questions, you can post it on Piazza and get an answer(suggestion) very quickly. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED AGAIN!
Great professor. Wrote a whole book about statistical learning just for our class, and his videos are very informative.

Dave is hands-down the best Stat professor I've had at UIUC. He's easy to talk to, great at explaining concepts, and truly teaches you R. (unlike many other profs) His interest and enthusiasm are contagious, and he's also very "real" about what machine learning is. Easy grader, not a ton of work. Would definitely take again.
He is a very organized professor who always tries his best for the students. I learned a lot of stuff about machine learning in his class.
BEST PROFESSOR AT UIUC! Very clear and always super prepared for the class! I learned a lot from this class and it was very useful for my internship.

Dave was funny and sarcastic, but not the best teacher. He moves VERY quickly and its hard to keep up during lectures. Lectures were really long also, and my notes were unorganized. I had no idea what I was doing most of the time, but exams were pretty easy. The class is called Biostatistics, but they were barely related.

The homework is every week basically and easier than in his 400 class. His explanations were clear. He helps you out as much as you want since not many go to his office the day or two after homework is due.  Tests are similar.  He also introduced me to R markdown, different applications in R and usage of different packages -  Golden resource
Good professor! Homurous ! I think almost everyone gets at least an "A-" .

Easy A.  Show up to lecture and he'll give you the test problems but with different numbers, for practice.  Funny lecturer, though he makes many snide comments about random things that he seems to be strangely ardent about.  God bless this man
I love this guy. Had him for 400 and 420--definitely take his classes!

The good news and bad news about this class: the homework  As long as you had put the time in for the homework (which are lengthy), you'll do well on the tests.  The margin of error out of 400 was not much at all, but  even so, you learn even if lecture would end up being a snooze.   Very kind person, funny lecturer.  Textbook not needed.

Professor Dalpiaz is one of the best professors I have ever had at U of I.  If you regularly attend lecture and discussion and diligently do the homework you can easily get an A (though nearly half the class never goes).  His office hours are great for getting homework help or simply just shooting the breeze.  I'd definitely recommend him.

Helpful, engaging, patient, and enjoyable professor. He even answered my questions via email the day of an exam. Homework is straightforward and helps to nail down understanding of the material. Lectures are always focused but somehow fun and enjoyable. His notes are helpful. He provides a free electronic version of the textbook for all students!
One of the most useful classes I've taken! It helps that the class wasn't terribly difficult and he was very clear with his expectations.

Probably one of the best professors at U of I. Clear and upfront with what he expects and great lecturer. Homework can get a little lengthy, but not ridiculously challenging. Must take if its your firstonly stat class.

He does not post slides and often makes mistakes in lecture. Exams and lectures are riddled with spelling  mistakes. I emailed the professors twice about an issue I had and nobody responded. Lectures are barely relevant to the MPs and are insanely boring. Tough class, but rewarding if you put in the work. He just makes it hard to learn.
D1 yapper, nobody likes the goofy ahh music in lecture

lectures are literally awful. how do you lecture with BLANK SLIDES to 900+ people. this impedes my learning heavily and he does not have clear talking points whatsoever. better use of my time to self study out of class, disappointing for such a good cs program at uiuc.

His lectures are very boring, and he has a habit of playing weird music at the beginning of the lecture. He replies on Discord faster than emails, and he's on Discord 24/7. His lectures are irrelevant to the MPs and exams.

Professor is knowledgeable but provides boring lectures that are better off learning yourself. Lines for TAs during discussion were way too long. Documentation for MPs can be unclear at times. Overall, the professor is overrated and has an ineffective teaching style.

As a person, he is good, but as a lecturer, he cannot lecture to save his life, and I am not exaggerating, but the sheer drop in the amount of people who show up to lecture during the first few days as compared to mid-semester is sad, given the class size. You are better off learning content from online resources. The MPs were hard but good.

He rejects MANY ec final projects (also directly relating to A+) without a good reason. Our group has written a really complete and organized proposal but NO ONE can prove that they'll fully stick with proposal.
His lectures are slow, just watch them at home if you can.
MP instructions aren't clear. Start only after you understand everything.

You know, I heard a lot of good things about this guy before I took CS 225 - to be honest, I was really excited to take this course because everyone hyped this class and Carl Evans. Unfortunately, Carl Evans has been making CS 225 more difficult every semester, and the quizzes in CBTF are meant to buck you over with gotcha questions.
Honestly one of the most overrate professors here at U of I. I was a little disappointed with his way of teaching and leading the course.

Very easy A, lots of extra credit, fun final project. You will learn a lot of useful things through the class, although there is a fair share of work involved. Find yourself a good final proj group and you will enjoy!

Professor himself was very chill but lecture was kinda slow. Goes over easy concepts too slowly and hard concepts a bit too fast.
pretty easy due to a lot of extra credit but a fair bit of work

Hardest class I ever took. Also, single most beneficial class I ever took.
Give him the time he deserves!
Go 'head be gone with it!
The MP/lab starter code is as messy as it gets. He is just not a tidy programmer.
Great professor, tough class for 241 so don't expect it to be a walk in the park but he is very accommodating of students
Great lectures, and always available. He runs a highly active discord server where he regularly answers questions. The lectures were also engaging and well structured.
There are 100 points extra credit. OH take a long time to get through sometimes 5-6 hours. It is a difficult class and the MP's, Lab's, and Exams are hard.

Decent lecturer who excels at course administration. Assignments for the most part are well structured and designed to set you up to succeed. Office hours have historically been awful for this class (a byproduct of how large it is), but he tries to mitigate this by being active on the class Discord. The class is very well run otherwise.

CS225 is a great class but you could definitely learn all concepts online. Lectures were held on Twitch and were pointless tbh. Heavy work. If you're not dedicating at least 15-20 hours weekly, then it's very hard to pass. The MP's, Labs, and Exams are all challenging. It's a weed out class, so make sure to put lots of effort from Day 1. OH suck!

Lectures are honestly useless if you have taken CS173 and CS126 before there is no point in attending them because it's not mandatory and he goes off topic so many times. If u need to learn a specific thing he records his live streams and uploads on twitch which is helpful! Overall prof.'s lectures meant nothing to the class

A great professor for CS 225, did his best in Fall 2020 to keep things going smoothly at all times. A lot of people complained about office hours and other things that were hard for him to control, if you look past that he seemed like a really great guy and professor!

I have to admit that this class sucked. The lectures didn't make sense and that there was so much work. Office hours is a hit and miss at times. Be prepared to wait in office hours for at least 5 hours and the TAs not be able to help you throughly with the issues with your code. I felt like this class didn't teach us proper debugging tools.

The work in this class is not too hard but there is just so much. And if you need any type of help, it's just not there. They go on and on about all the resources available but honestly, nobody answers the Piazza and OH is always hit or miss (usually miss) with long waiting times.

Professor Evans is extremely responsive outside of lectures. He's always helping students on the class piazza/discord and is very approachable. However, lectures are oftentimes unorganized and poorly paced. I watched the recordings of Professor Wade's CS 225 lectures instead.

Great professor who truly cares about his students! This was especially evident during the COVID-19 pandemic in which he went above and beyond to make himself available all the time and ensure fairness. Although his lectures may not be the best, they were pretty good and along with the amazing assignments, learning the content was never a struggle.
Horrible- unnecessary discrepancies between local tests and online ones in POTDs. Quizzes are like all or nothing. Disorganized. Nightmare professor overall.

Had Evans for CS173 and got an A but was really hoping not to have him again, hes unhelpful and kind of a jerk. Had him for CS225... Again, got an A because I taught myself everything, didnt go to a single lecture because I knew from 173 how terrible a professor he is.

Pretty dreadful lecturer honestly, fortunately, the notes posted online are decent enough to help you through the labs and MPs if you're willing to put in the work to understand it. As with many CS classes, stackoverflow may be your best friend for this class

Carl is incredibly nice and easy to talk to, so its a shame that hes such a bad lecturer. Had him for 126 and 225, he added almost nothing to the course that couldn't be found online or from previous semesters. Tries his very best to teach and is sincere about wanting feedback, but just can't get it right. Just very unclear and disorganized.
CS225 is the ultimate easy A. And the contents have been taught really well.

I had him for both 126 and 225. He isn't the best lecturer, but is decently understandable, unlike some professors. He is fairly reasonable . His courses were all well established, so they ran based more on how they were set up than based on his preferencese.
Absolutely horrible. Had him for 126 but now stuck with him in 225. Don't bother attending his lectures, because he has zero teaching ability. I would like a refund on my tuition...
Average lectures, although sometimes on interesting topics. Knows his stuff, doesn't teach it very well.

This course should make sense. Fleck's book is very well-written and that's the only way I got through the course at all. Every single class, Evans appeared flustered and disorganized. His explanations didn't make sense and he couldn't stand up to students that challenged his proofs. Lecture confused me more than it helped, so I just stopped going.

His class was very funny, but the lectures weren't really worth the time it took to attend. The Maps weren't extremely easy, but definitely doable. The MP difficulty is really going to be based on your code moderator though, but you'll learn what they want quickly and ultimately it does help you improve your coding style.

This class was managed extremely poorly. Nearly every MP assignment had a bug in it and Evans would acknowledge it and not do anything about it. He's a funny guy though. He misspelled the words "peppermint" and "lettuce" live in front of us and that's when I knew that I was in for a treat that semester. The class itself isn't difficult though.

His lectures are fairly detailed and he's good at explaining confusing topics. The work load is extremely heavy in this course, with weekly projects ranging from 5 to 15 hours a week. The rubric for projects are not often explained well.

Even though I haven't taken too many CS classes in UIUC, I believe that he is the single worst professor I'll meet. His lectures are boring, full of professional vocabs, no intention to explain things the easy way. His rubric is vague, but the TA can just take off points whenever they want. Homework load is HUGE. Expect at least 10 hours a week.
Memorize Angrave's wiki and get an "A"

I think Evans is a pretty new professor, and was teaching a course that changes a lot. Still, I think he did a great job teaching the course: his lectures were mostly clear and useful; he was funny, but not to the point that it detracted from his lecturing; and he made a HARD course interesting and doable. I HIGHLY suggest ATTENDING his lectures.
An excellent, entertaining professor that made otherwise excruciatingly difficult material bearable.

Absolutely best prof I have had in UIUC. He gave us multiple extensions just because some of us are lagging behind a bit within reason. Even though the class is difficult in nature with a lot of content, he make the entire experience exceptional. GOAT, he is why I paid the big bucks for UIUC tuition.
Nothing more to say. GOAT.

Honestly struggled in this class because I was taking tough courses, but every time i showed up to lecture it felt fresh and fun. By far one of the best lecturers I've taken! We get worksheets to follow along which are great :) He's very supportive and understanding, he knows when to be tough yet is forgiving and understanding.

He is an outstanding professor and teaches incredibly. If you don't like live lectures he has an archive of past lectures, and if you don't like lectures his online textbook is incredibly helpful as well. Start on MPs early and you should be good to go.
Goat

The practice exam is not related to the final exam AT ALL, which was released just the day after the course eval was closed to avoid students' bad ratings. There were also many typos in the final exam, and the TAs and the professor clarified nothing and told us to figure them out ourselves. His TAs' piazza answers are usually short and unhelpful.

Amazing lecturer, among the best. Very knowledgeable, makes class entertaining and easy to understand. Class has excessively difficult MPs. Every MP are two steps abstracted from lecture. Tons of documentation, but it takes me hours just to understand how to get started. Difficult quizzes. For normal semesters, no free points. Do everything.
I normally don't show up to lectures, but I showed up to nearly all of his. I thought 241 was the most difficult class I ever took, however it was also my favorite.

SO overrated. Lectures better than most, BUT: class is structured and organized horribly, disjointed assignment topics, unhelpful TAs, autograders that crash, heavily-weighted obscure multiple choice on quiz/exam, takes up a huge amount of time. Professor doesn't manage anything at all. Just an awful class experience, hated every second of it.

He is an awesome lecturer! He's got a bunch of fun extra materials about the course content. The course is not particularly hard if you have prior experience in C and some networking stuff. MPs are a big part.
The lecture feedback app sucks but he's a cool guy, awesome accent too

The class in general was badly-run and badly-supported by the infrastructure. But Angrave's lectures were amazing and I learned a lot even with all the problems. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you REALLY need to know the material if you decide to skip lecturethe TAs in discussion and lab are unreliable help if you miss something important.
Second time taking a class with Angrave (first time was with CS125) and he is the best lecturer I've ever taken between preparedness and enthusiasm which makes going to class worth it.

This course is difficult, I can see that Angrave tried best to make this course more fascinating. Some lectures are really interesting but some lectures, such as those on file system and part II signals, because of lack of practice of labs, quizzes and mps, really make students confused. But in general, this course is awesome.
The amazing class! Angrave is really a enthusiastic teacher and willing to tell you everything ! Learned a lot in this course!

Fantastic lecturer. Keeps class informing and also entertaining,  something which is very hard to do since some of the concepts are dry and syntax heavy.   Difficult course in terms of workload but also very rewarding. You will walk out being an expert programmer in C and understanding how system programming is done.
Great lecturer. His way of teaching is highly engaging and visual as well. He makes Systems programming both fun and interesting.
CS 241 is hard. It takes a lot of time to finish all MPs and Labs. The material is messy. Final exam is extremely hard compared to midterms and quizzes. Wikibook is the best source for learning.

CS 241 definitely is hard and time consuming, be prepare. Angrave explain so well on the synchronization primitive. This class is worth if you are CS major. Start everything early, mps and labs will be fine. Make sure to work hard in the beginning because that is the hardest period. After that, the course will start getting easier. Good luck.

CS 241 is an overall hard class. The MPs and Lab will take up a lot of time out of your week. Its difficult to start early but Do it!. The midterms are fairly reasonable if you do the MPs and Labs and fully understand them. For the final, the rumors are true it is much much harder than then midterms but on equal level of the quizzes.

Great lecturer on very thought-provoking material. Some of the MPs and labs are tough, but the midterms are generally much easier.  He promotes a friendly and engaging atmosphere, and really knows his stuff.
Awesome lecturer, super engaging and has made CS241 a memorable, yet still difficult, class
Angrave has such enthusiasm, it really made the lectures enjoyable. Start Mp's and labs early because you get 6-7 autograder, and you'll be fine
He's a god amongst men. He talked like a pirate on talk like a pirate day. And ate a rubber ducky. He's a goddam legend
This professor and this class inspired me to transfer into Computer Science.

The main problem with this class is that it is organized very poorly. Professor is not helpful at all when it comes to questions about assignments. Also, lectures are dull and lack structure. The TA's work incredibly hard to create and run the MP's. But I wish the professor was more helpful. Only managed to do okay by studying a ton before exams.
Great professor but the final exam is extremely hard.  Make sure you go to class. Bad course policy! We got 5% for midterm and 7.5% for each quiz.
Contents are presented fragmented in the class. Feedbacks from MPs are weeks later when you already forgot what you write. The worst class I had on this campus.

NO PPT, pointless lecture. Need old PPT to follow lecture. I did not drop the class because first 8 week (drop deadline) only 1 MP due, BUT the rest 8 weeks have 4 MPs.  At the last few weeks HE gives some random "50 Questions HW" to be done in one week with another MP due, which takes 4% of the total grade AND IS NOT *** IN SYLLABUS AT ALL.

241 is probably the worst class I ever taken. System programming is supposed to be hard, and yes, he does make it tough, but no, not in the right way.  However, I don't think the instructor is the only one to blame.
The instructor is the worst one I have ever meet in CS course, so if you want good grade, you'd better skipping his class.
The WORST quality "Teacher" at University of Illinois CS department. I learn nothing in this class. Worst lecture, worst pop quiz, worst final. Keep far away from this guy in CS241!!!!

Poor lecture quality. Poor lab section. Poor mp. You never learn anything. He almost ruined this serious topic. I suggest everyone who wants to take this course next semester wait until CS department sets Lawrence back to CS125 and haves another serious lecturer for this.
It is not worth your time if you are not interested in systems
hard class, fast pace, high workload.  It worths 12 credit
Every MP was broken, weekly quizzes were too hard... the quality of the course would have been acceptable if it was the first time this course was ran.
Real fun classes
best professor ever

Great Professor, first time programming and managed an A-. Took a bit of work though. If you have had rigorous experience with recursion, this class might be a joke to you. Take it anyway , Angrave is the bee's knees.

Each lecture was trying to decipher his analogies than actually learning the material. It's my first time coding, and I don't think it's an easy class. Need to be able to devote a lot of time to do well if you don't pick up on stuff that easily. Midterms 2 and 3 were pretty hard, so be sure you have time for this class!
Amazing professor.
The Best CS Professor on campus

Angrave is a great professor. He definitely does his best to keep the class interesting, and he does a great job of it. The MPs are helpful and the tests are fair. Overall, its a very easy class if you have prior programming experience, but definitely doable even if you don't. Very nice, funny, and intelligent professor.
Awesome Professor! Really put a lot of effort into making the course an amazing CS introductory course. Definitely learnt a lot and the MPs given were very interesting as well!
Wat a guy. If youre reading this, angrave, give yourself a pat on the back
One word: awesome.
You can really tell he is passionate about CS and teaching his students. Not only that, but he is also extremely intelligent and funny. He is everything you could ever want in a Professor.
My first time programming, Angrave made it a breeze! this class is one of the best classes ever!
best class I have ever take in my freshman year in UofI
Overall excellent professor! It's a CS course, so don't expect it to be easy, but he is so enthusiastic that it makes going to lecture fun--and extremely useful!
He is great and funny. Love his British accent. I can't be more thankful that taking this course with him inspired me to transfer to computer science major.
This guy is incredible.
Lawrence Angrave: the most entertaining CS professor you will ever have.
Excellent teacher. Not only is he extremely funny but makes sure that the class gets a firm grip on the concepts.

Seldom am I inspired to do anything non-mandatory, but this teacher is so inspiring, teaches so incredibly well, and gives the students every possible tool they could use to pass this class that I felt the need to tell everyone here. If possibly, take this class.

What an unbelievable guy. I had him my freshman year at UIUC and he truly inspired me to go into computer science while providing me with a solid foundation to stem from. I'm a software Engineer at Google now and couldnt be more thankful to Angrave for starting it all off.

He's charismatic and helpful. He might make you want to switch to CS at the end of it all. As far as the class goes, it might be difficult for the non-technically minded, but all the resources are there to help (lectures, readings, section, office hours, debug your brain, piazza for constant web support), and grading is almost too forgiving. If you don't manage at least a B in this class with some fair effort CS might not be for you.
He is awesome!!!!

Hilarious professor and made lectures interesting. Lectures aren't mandatory but they're helpful and interesting. The MPs can be tough but he regrades them for full credit the following week. Overall, interesting class but without prior Java experience it won't be easy.
Angrave made my love computer science! I really suggest taking his class even if you don't think you're interested in CS! He is a fantastic teacher.

Best professor I will ever have in my Career as a Student. Shows us funny videos before every class and just keeps joking around to make sure that we do indeed focus in class. He knows how to make fun and work Mix..he has a childlike enthusiasm. Do your Readings and MP's in advance and you will experience the best class in the history of UIUC.
Makes CS fun and can answer any question.
He's a complete baller. This class was really fun to go to every day. He is loud exciting and funny and truly makes an effort to make the class fun. He also has a british accent.
hilarious/crazy guy. he dressed up like a pirate and talked like one for a day. got on top of desks and more. Take his class!!
I wish all of my professors were Angrave.
So Funny

A fantastic professor--he teaches the introduction to CS for everyone in the department for a reason.  He expects a lot from you, but the class never feels hard (although you'll probably do a lot of work for it).  Even with no prior programming experience, I aced the class and had a lot of fun.
Angrave is literally the best professor on campus.  Always enthusiastic, always knowledgeable, and always looking to help his students.  Great man.

If you are thinking about majoring, or even minoring, in CS, you have to take this class with Angrave. Not that you have a choice really, but there's definitely no one better to teach you for this course. :)
One of the best professors ever.

Angrave is fast-praced with high expectations but entirely engaging. There is always help when you need it though. Discussion counts for points (reinforcing worksheets and then a computer-based lab), so go to them. Don't put off your exercises or MPs! I highly recommend having prior programming experience, as most people in the class do.

Angrave tried to interact with the class, keeping class interesting most of the time. The MP's progressively got more difficult, and he expected you to understand everything very quickly. If you needed help, there was always someone to help. Overall he was a good professor. Keep up with class, do practice exams to be prepared for the tests.
A legend among professors. Surely the best professor ever.
BEST TEACHER ANYONE CAN HAVE. PERIOD.
Makes the material not only interesting but fun to understand and gives plenty of help in understanding concepts. Awesome Teacher! Take his class if you have any interest in coding.

Angrave's the best prof I've ever had. If you haven't seen the material before, you're going to have to work your butt off. The grading is fair and there are practice exams, so it is possible to do well if you don't have prior programming experience. However, don't even consider this is you're just looking for an easy Quant 1.
not a hard course.just stay with the class and remember to do the practice exams.
Best professor, ever, period.
The man, myth and legend, Lawrence Angrave is the best professor you will ever have in college.
Fantastic professor, very helpful, approachable, and willing to give his time to his students!

I absolutely love and adore him!He is the best professor ever....and is really cute too lol! but besides that fact he makes class sooo much fun that people who even hate computer science would fall in love! take him for sure!
One of the best professors I've had!
Pretty good professor. Lectures can be somewhat vague, but there are plenty of office hours and online resources to help out. He's got a good sense of humor, and manages to keep things interesting.
awesome class!

He is an awesome professor. He makes his class so much fun and has cool jokes and tricks in every one of his classes. Attendance is not mandatory per se but u cannot succeed without attending his lectures which I always look forward to. Probably one of the best professors in the whole university.
OMG! what an amazing professor, enjoy his show!

Lectures are fun, but at times I have a hard time keeping up with what he's saying, I think it's the australian accent haha. The exams are okay and the MPs get harder throughout the semester, so be careful.

He makes lectures enjoyable and is also very willing to answer questions during or after lectures. Grading is fair. Do all the mps and you'll be fine. Overall, best class to take at U of I!!!I totally enjoy this class. ps; I didn't have any programming experience prior taking this class. It's not that hard as it might sound.
I want to give him a hug.
Probably the best professor I have ever known. the class is really fun and he has a good sense of humor. There are a lot of extra credit opportunities (I ended up with over a 100% score).

Lawrence Angrave is the best computer science teacher I have ever had. He has a real passion for what he does and I highly recommend taking this course if you are looking for a good cs class to take. Be forewarned, there are weekly MPs (Machineproblems) due each Monday at 8 pm, and they require around 3-8 hours of work, depending on your experience
He was a fantastic lecturer.  This class was amazing and truly reccomend it to others.  He made  me excited to attend class.
Awesome Professor and an awesome lecturer. He's very upbeat which helps keep my attention, very clear, and he's always open for questions in the lecture and before/after the lecture.

if you're having a bad day (or a good day) go to class. angrave is fun, quirky, inspiration, and quite an idealist. lots of talk about true love and zombies. if you sit in the front you will be called out for examples. if you haven't programmed before it will be difficult but if you're willing to put in the time i definitely recommend the class

Very enthusiastic, and helps get you excited about the material.  His teaching style is very visual and memorable, so if his explanations click, they really stay with you. But I felt that his explanations tended to lack clarity, and I may have been confused if I didn't know most of the material. But he makes up for it by offering lots of re-grades.

I highly recommend Prof. Angrave.  He clearly loves what he does and knows a lot about Java.  I had not known anything about the subject before taking this class and he made it seem easy and helped a lot.  I actually stopped doing the readings halfway through the semester and he lectures were clear enough for me to get an A.
Pretty easy class.  Professor was funny when I went, but going to class certainly is not necessary.  As long as you do a couple hours of work each week there is no excuse to not get an A.
great
wheee
Unusually humorous and highly understandable - that's a gem for computer science professors!

Not really that good at explaining. If I didn't know anything about CS before taking this class, I would have had a hard time. He spends the whole class joking and teaches very little, yet wants you to go to every lecture as if it's incredibly important.
Great, clear, funny, fair.

Very charismatic and excited about the subject, and in that sense he gets you excited as well. He does seem many times to spend more time trying to entertain the students than actually effectively teach matter. A lot of students have to rely on others and the internet a lot of the time to understand topics in the MPs.

One of the most charismatic teachers at the Universitiy. He loves his work, and he'll make you love it too. While it was one of my trickier classes, it was the only class I loved to attend. Lectures are riddled with jokes and demonstrations. The difficult and abstract subject matter is make quite simple. Highly recommend Prof. Angrave.

A charismatic teacher that really knows his stuff. He tries to lighten up lectures by telling corny jokes and letting students to interact with each other. Could be a bit better while explaining concepts, but he has brought many students a long way and is one of the best.
Always made himself available and was a lot of fun to listen to during lectures. Truly a great proffessor

He's a great teacher, clearly in love with his work and tries to make the students fall in love with CS as well. Always incredibly interesting and funny (in a cheesy way). And you can't go wrong with that accent! Ow ow!

Great professor! Very experienced in not only the course material, but it's applications as well(he had two start ups before, one was bought by EA and I forgot about the other). Has great interest in teaching, and good clarity. MPs are neither hard nor easy, but plain fun. Highly recommended.
Good professor. I would recommend him
Welcome to the Matrix. That's this guy. Totally dedicated to the subject of system programming and doing "cool stuff" with computers is what Prof. Angrave is all about.
This guy is awesome.

I loved it when he took the floor. He is so charismatic and can make hard concepts seem simple. He can really get you motivated about computer science and relates all the things you'll learn in his class to upper level courses. He also brings in guest speakers. The projects you do are challenging but practical. He's one of the best.

Great professor, very patient and works with her students to help them be successful in the class! The class is very linear algebra and multi-variable calculus heavy so your strengths in those topics basically determine what you get out of the class.

The prof is very hard to follow and her material does not co-relate to the homework. I have used github as reference for these homeworks and have been good so far. Grind hard before quizzes and you'll be 'chillin

three weeks in and this course is already a disaster. the quiz had broken questions which the professor promised would be taken care of later, however now she is only giving the option to retake the entire quiz but won't give points for something that's her fault cause it could be unfair to other students.

The professor puts in no effort for this class. She runs the class using the same material from a previous professor from 9 years ago. That's why the TAs and the professor are clueless and leave it up to us to figure things out.
Least organized professor at the university. No flow between topics. Has outdated lecture videos which don't do a good job explaining.

Some people find this class to be tedious due to the PrairieLearn setup, however I found that it allows for students to get out of the course what they want to. The practice quizzes and quizzes have the same bank with unlimited practice quiz attempts. I think anyone that put in ~10 hours/week could receive an A.

This class should not have been this hard. The quizzes were always a pain when it came to the coding questions. How are people with very minimum coding experience in Python expected to know to just code with the math based leetcode type questions?
Professor Silva is an amazing teacher and person. I got to know her better during her office hours, and ultimately had her write me a letter of recommendation.
Awful note ecosystem. Frequently, the prerecorded videos will have typos, and / or are explained poorly.
Know your linear algebra before taking this class...
I did not find the lectures that helpful. If you do the homework, it should be sufficient to do well on the quizzes. The MPs could be documented better.
This class trolls hard

She did not care about student's opinions and feedback until way too far into the semester. At the end it turned out ok as long as you did the practice quizzes and exam but her as a prof would not recommend.

Besides being extremely petty, she's actually a good/fun professor. This class could've been a lot more boring but she made it fun and something to look forward to every week. It's an easy A if you do the work (which is not a lot).

The course website has a lot of useful resources (helped me a lot with learning Python), and lectures were decent. All the homeworks, group assignments, and quizzes/exams were on Prairelearn. Group assignments were doable, quizzes and homeworks were similar in difficulty, and she allowed us to use resources on the course website during quizzes.

This professor did not adjust well to online teaching. The course itself is fine, and pretty easy. However, there were at times frustrating issues with the online courseware this professor was using. It wasn't always clearly communicated. I am someone who reads the website, and is self motivated and I still struggled to figure out what she wanted.

Prof. Silva was a good professor. Her notes were really helpful for the quizzes and her lectures were decent. The homework prepared you for the quizzes. As long as you attend lecture and keep up with the homework, an A is not too difficult. She is really caring and even reviewed my buggy code personally on Piazza. One of the most underrated profs

Some of the coding problems on the homework were hard to debug. The homeworks prepared you well for the quizzes. I found all the quizzes and the final managable. The lectures were not that good, and while I managed to figure out how to do the problems on the exams, I did not understand the theory behind many of the concepts.

Okay so I took this class in Spring 2020 (the semester of COVID). The first half of this class was in person as normal and it was fine. The beginning of the class was definitely a little tricky in terms of material though. After things transitioned online, Prof Silva was extremely accommodating and caring and I really admired that.
Mariana is unreasonable and super petty. Probably needs therapy (I mean same)

Professor Silva is many things, but a good teacher is not one of them. The quizzes focus on everything you didn't see in the homework. She has specifically said she searches the slides for things she did not put in homework to test on. Pretty unprofessional, always talking about how she knows students do not like her in a weird way
good prof!!!
Stuck up. Debugging is sometimes really difficult, absolutely garbage problems at times. Office hours is a complete joke
Too much in a hurry. Always talking faster than anyone can understand. Can't survive without rewatching lectures. Pretty fun at times though.
Quizzes are so hard to pass and she will never give you a break from homework and quizzes. Very time consuming and even when you'll study for the quizzes you won't do well.

She made the class a LOT EASIER than before, since the Prairelearn NOW gives us the answers to the questions we can share with more people ahead of time. I'm a math major and I took it as Math 357, so I took the class for an easy A cuz I had the help of people ahead of me. She forgets to record her own voice but that doesn't affect my performance.
I wouldn't give her a high grade because she turns off the volume of recording intentionally to force students to take her class. Besides that, the rest is fine.

Prof. Silva is the BEST I've had in Chambana. A pleasure in lecture and office hours, cares about students, answers emails (quickly), and fantastic lecture presence. Highly recommended!

Best Professor I've seen in U of I. Amazing lectures offered, and very clear explanation. Dr. Silva is always open for students.  I took her TAM 211 for my first semester as a freshman in college. Dr. Silva is a great professor - very clear and structured lectures, fair exams (she gives major hints on exam content).

One of my best professors so far. Her presentation of the material is very clear –  I highly recommend her. Also, some advice: attend all review sessions. The example problems are almost identical to the ones on the exams.
Awesome professor! She makes everything understandable and tells you exactly what's going to be on the midterms. Go to lecture because she moves quickly.
so nice and helpful! offers lots of extra credit and the exams are very straightforward. she even tells you what's going to be on them. one of the best professors I've had.
so nice and helpful! offers lots of extra credit and the exams are very straightforward. she even tells you what's going to be on them. one of the best professor's I've had.

She is very helpful and teaches very well.  Her cheerful manner really helped since the class was at 9 am.  She is definitely one of my favorite professors.  Tests weren't really all that hard and there was plenty of extra credit available.  If you can take a class with her, take it.
She is really good and cares about her students. Helps a lot during the tests and wants her students to excel.

Awesome professor. She was very helpful throughout the entire course, and you can tell that she actually cares about her students' success. Very kind and helpful. She definitely cares about her students.

Probably worst core cs class. The lectures are useless as it is just slide readings. Everything is poorly organized. The homework are useless busy work that is graded long after its relevance.

AWFULL!!! Almost nothing prepares you for the exams. Complete nightmare!

This class was a nightmare. Not only is the content inherently hard, the professor makes no effort to help students learn it. Just awful.The grading is so bad, so many issues with how class is structured, unclear extra credit, exam material hard to prepare for, home works is on your own no examples, lectures are read from slides, can go on forever. she's very engaging

In my opinion, the course would greatly improve if there were pre-lecture videos to explain the theory and a lecture with real-time solving of problems similar to the homework so students can also see an application of the theory already taught. class taught very poorly

Pretty good professor, very caring and is very understanding of how students struggle. Class was fairly graded and expectations were clear. Good prof but lectures can sometimes go over time.

She is a real nice and responsible professor!!

Great prof!

her lectures are super confusing. she doesnt help with the coding but just expects you to teach yourself everything. this class has been an exercise in watching youtube and teaching myself. she will yell at you for going to the bathroom in a 200 person lecture. she literally asked people to ask permission to use the bathroom. do not take her class

Good professor with good lectures, you can tell he cares for students.

Wonderful!

Great Class!

interesting class
