Awesome course. Lectures were practical and the projects were well-defined upfront. Bailey was always prepared for class. I recommend it!
Great TA, really invested in students' success, gave good feedback- would definitely take another course with her.

Christian has a very deep understanding and appreciation for European literature, and her passion overflows into her discussion sections. The feedback she gave on essays was extremely helpful for me and helped me become a better writer. She is a tough, but fair grader, and she truly cares about the success of her students. Highly recommended!

Superlatives I would use to describe her are knowledgeable and passionate for CPLT. She gives constructive feedback on essays which is great because improvement is rewarded in this class - good incentive for hard work. Christian's lectures in discussion were vital for clarification of the texts! It was a true pleasure to have such a fantastic TA.

Christian Howard taught a discussion section for European Literature this fall, and she is excellent at explaining things. She is understanding, a fair grader, and works hard to help her students succeed. I would highly recommend taking a class with her.

Professor Howard was extremely helpful throughout the course of taking this class.  She is very knowledgeable, and has a lot of interesting ideas about the texts.  Conversation during discussions is very beneficial.  She also gives out a final review, and grades all your papers, so she's an important person to listen to
Christian was an amazing TA. I became a much better writer due to her feedback on my papers. The actual professor was really pretty terrible at teaching and Christian made up for it by being awesome.

When the dismal lectures seemed almost impossible to comprehend, Christian cleared the way for understanding. She is intelligible on every topic and gives great insight to discussions. While she's a tough grader, she gives very constructive criticism. I owe any and all success to her as my TA because I would've essentially failed without her.
She made some pretty impossible lectures comprehensible as my TA. Bit of a tough grader but I definitely got better as the semester went on. Made discussions interesting. Definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed having Christian as my TA for my comparative literature class. She always clarified any questions we had from lectures and was very enthusiastic and caring. I would definitely recommend taking a class with her or choosing her as your TA!
read aloud every single paper she handed out... which was fine, just super annoying and time consuming.
Christian is a fair grader, very approachable and very nice. Definitely would recommend taking her class.

I truly enjoyed this class. Christian Howard is a great teacher who will always be available to answer questions on anything. I recommend this class to anyone who has to take a writing requirement. Her grading is very fair, as she tells you in advance what she expects to see in your writing.

This class was not what I was expecting (reading literature and analyzing psychotic characters, etc.), but I thoroughly enjoyed it nonetheless. We looked at the various approaches to and portrayals of 'madness' across all genres of film, story, and art. Good class, wonderful teacher-always ready to help and give feedback.

Christian Howard was an incredible ENWR professor. While a fair but tough grader, she aims to make you a better writer and help you improve your skill with each paper.  An outstanding class all around; she created a wonderful and fun atmosphere. Highly recommended.
Christian is a great teacher! She's a tough grader sometimes, but very fair. She is also very knowledgeable about the topics she teaches, which makes the class more interesting and inviting.

Christian is a fantastic teacher with lots of knowledge about various topics. I would highly recommend taking a class with her if you are at all interested in the topic, I know that I would take her again if I could.

He is a good professor, teaches less but explains well right from the basics. His exams are fairly easy although the assignments are time consuming (a bit hard). He stresses on learning how to tackle problems instead of mugging up the methods. On the flip side, he is quite busy and misses a few classes because of conferences, meetings etc.
Prof. Khurana's a great professor, she's very understanding and caring. Gives great lectures and knows the field really well. Really enjoyed taking the course.

Professor Park isn't as bad as people think. I had him for ResEcon 213 as well, and despite it being awful, it's the class, not him. Even though he has like 40+ slides per lecture, he really does care about students understanding material, and is willing to help students out when they need it. Good professor, just has confusing material to teach

Professor Park provides a variety of assignments and includes opportunities for extra credit too. While material can be challenging sometimes, Prof Park seems fair and creates ways for students to have the chance to do well if they put in effort and ask questions. He seems approchable.
He's very nice and all but he doesn't know how to teach. No readings, just lecture and reading slides. There was no practice exam and nothing to prepare for first midterm.
Just terrible. He just reads the slides and goes on monotonously. It's boring and unbearable.

Avoid this class if you can. The class is so unorganized, impossible to follow lectures, it isn't clear what textbook he use, no class schedule. Homeworks' phrasing is so bad you have to re-read many times to understand. Sometimes, he confuses himself and he's all over the place.

I feel like professor Park gets a lot of bad reviews just because people didn't take the time to learn the material. yes he is new and it wasn't the best but if time was taken it wasn't overly difficult. Especially with the easy final project, it boosts your grade a lot. Also allowed for a sheet of notes on exams which made them that much easier.

Yongjoon is a young and very intelligent professor but its clear that it was his first time teaching. After the class failed the first exam (lowest grade i've ever received) he tried to be more clear but his lectures and rambles of numbers on the board were still impossible to follow. Granted the material is tough, he made it much more confusing.

I really want to like professor Park, because he is extremely kind and really does want to help. However, the way he presents material is very unhelpful; the homeworks are time consuming; and the tests are HORRIBLE (everyone failed our midterm yet there was no scaling). If you want to succeed in this class its basically all self taught. Good luck.

He did not know how to teach. I only have complaints about his class. There were 2 exams, both extremely difficult and worth 25-35 percent of the grade(the class average was below a 60). He assigned a project in R. We had no assignments or prior experience using R, so the project was nearly impossible to complete. His lectures were unhelpful.

Yongjoon is by far the worst professor I've had at Umass Amherst. His lectures are unclear and hard to follow. All he does is information dump for 75 minutes straight making the class extremely unengaging and he's out of touch with the students in his class. If you have to take this class, avoid Yongjoon for your own sake.

Prof. Park is very earnest and approachable. While the class subject matter can be hard at times, he tries to make the content more accessible and engaging, and I feel like I am learning a lot overall. I also noticed that he has adapted his teaching and materials a bit over the semester to help us learn, which I appreciate. He seems smart and kind.
I hate this class! I have to memorize everything for midterms. It's the worst class I've ever taken. His lecture is very boring. I tried so hard to focus but was overwhelmed by tons of concepts.
213 is a hard class but he makes it especially unclear. He is kind of all over the place. Exams are 60% so if you mess up either one you are kind of screwed

He shows up every day with a slide show of typically 50 slides and you can tell he just wants to push through them and just reads off the slides and theres no teaching/student interaction. Studying for tests (60% of your grade) is left to you teaching yourself off the slides which are full of basic math errors, incorrect formulas, and poor grammar.

I think Yongjoon means well but he seems to be new to teaching and forgets that the class does not know as much as him. He does not teach he just lectures and it leaves me lost by the end of class. There is a textbook for this class but no assigned readings so I don't know what chapter to read each week.
Best Professor I have ever met.

I am really enjoying taking this course with Professor Han. Very clear and organized lectures. He provides an excellent historical perspective on the development of the field. Also, the homework is super fun and I look forward to each one being published so I can get started on it.

I feel like nothing is being learned in this class. His lectures are very boring and slides are too cluttered. Many people don't even attend class!  I respect his reputation and knowledge. But, as a student, this class has not been a good experience.

Professor Han is awesome. He's a big deal in data mining, and he's good at explaining the concepts, although sometimes how he writes his explanations and problems is slightly ambiguous. He's a super nice guy and his enthusiasm for the subject mixed with his accent and demeanor make him kind of charming and unintentionally funny. Would recommend.

He is probably the most famous person in data mining field, very fluent in English which is quite unexpected. Everything was good...until the midterm where few students were cheating and he did nothing. This event happened again in Final exam. Seriously? What is the point of being the most famous person in the field if his students cheat to get A?

Excellent at teaching, and surprisingly good at English. Famous at data mining field. Probably easiest class to cheat during the mid term and final exam, because there is only 1 proctor for both cases. (for midterm, He was the only one proctoring 120 students) Actually saw few students cheating, which makes it just unfair for everyone. Sad truth.

Darko and the TAs are extremely helpful. He and the TA in charge of our group project even went to meet us to troubleshoot some issues on one weekend. This class requires a lot of work, but if you do all assignments diligently (make sure to check and follow all instructions), you would have no problem getting A in this class.
Class contents are a little dry,  but he's always cracking jokes. Very active on class news groups. One of my favorite professors.
great professor. cares about students. learned a lot in his class.
Worst teacher I have ever had. Tons of meaningless repetitive tedious projects.
Responds to piazza and emails significantly faster than any other professor. He may not bring the most excitement to a class, but you can definitely tell he cares about his students.

Professor Marinov is very helpful, explains the material clearly and reflects on his experience in the field. Exams contains trick questions especially from the terms rarely used or confusing. Course material is shallow but breadth wide across all of SW Engineering. Project and HW are ok from load perspective. TA's are extremely helpful.

Professor is very helpful. Replies to email immediately. Explains the subject and reflects on his own experience. TA's are extremely helpful and supportive. Project and homeworks are relevant to course topics
Funny and badass mad scientist. Knows his stuff. Also helpful; sometimes shows up at study groups. Easy but educative class.

I loved Nan! He is  a little hard to understand at times, but his tests are fairly easy and he usually gave substantial bonus points for turning in some type of homework. Before every tests he sends out an incredibly detailed study guide that you can pretty much learn the material from. He's a pretty good option for Linear and always super nice!
Very helpful and nice. He may have used to be mean, but now he's changed.  Tests are difficult though.

very hard class. go to class and you will get used to his accent. do bonus problems because he assigns alot. he also curves the sh*t out of your grade. had a D+ going into the final came out with a B and i thought the final was very hard

He couldnt even work his own test problems on the board and he got angry when the students corrected him. My friend got every answer right on a test and she didnt even make an A on it. I didnt even know that was possible

He was a horrible teacher. Never did anything but write on the board and he didn't understand when you asked a question. He puts the exact test questions on the study guide, which makes you think it would be easy, but they are so hard and he refuses to help with those problems. I had 2 tutors and neither could ever finish a study guide!!
can't understand this guy

Nan is a nice guy. He is kind of hard to understand sometimes, but it's not too bad. You can tell he's trying to help his students understand. Quiz and test problems come straight from the study guide. Very fair grading as well.
great guy!

He was very helpful and understanding. If you know how to do the problems on the study guides you will make A's on the tests on quizzes.  He offers a couple bonus opportunities in order to help his students grades.

I took Nan Jiang for college algebra and the work was not difficult at all. The only problem is he doesn't know how to explain how to do a problem well. In order to understand you must pay close attention and then try to figure out how to do the problems yourself. Everyone in the class was stressed!
Nice guy, good grading
He is an expert of this area and knows what he is teaching. The lectures are clear and inspirational.
Slides were impossible to understand. Confusing explanations. I regretted the course

I took the class Information Extraction and Knowledge Acquisition taught by Prof. Ji last Fall. She explained everything so clearly that I was able to understand state-of-the-art information extraction techniques without much problem. In addition, she gave a lot of detailed feedback about my term paper. I truly have learned a lot.

Lectures are clear and concise while still being in-depth. You can tell Professor Heng Ji loves what she teaches, and she's good at teaching it. She is caring about students to learn the material properly and enjoy the class. What is more, She keeps involving students in the class. I really benefited a lot from taking this course.
Very knowledgable professor. The lectures include the most up-to-date research progress and are very informative.
Very nice professor. Good practice for anyone looking for NLP research opportunities.
Awesomeeeeeee!
I love this man!Gang Wang is smart
Gang is a good man
Gang is super educated and he can lead you to the true math field.
He is very hot!I love this instructor!
Gang is a wonderful TA!
Gang is really helpful as a TA of the course
Great teacher!
This is the best instructor I have met!!! I will definitely take his class again.
AWESOME TEACHER
Gang is an interesting TA and very helpful
A very nice teacher
Very good instructor
Gang is a great TA, his lectures are clear and helpful. He follows the basic format of the text but clarifies the concepts and gives lots of examples.

In the spirit of gratitude, I've decided to write about Professor Mehta here. In short, in addition to being a great lecturer, she cares a lot about students' learning AND their well being. 

Go to her office hours, because she WILL help you - she truly wants you to succeed, and don't take it for granted - such professors are few far in between.
Amazing course, and amazing teacher.
Amazing course. Prof. Mehta's lectures are clear, interactive, and with lots of examples. The HWs are tough but fun to work on. The course is demanding overall due to it's difficult content.

She is caring and nice to students, but her lectures are disorganized and her notes are hard to read. Homeworks are really hard, much more than the lecture examples. Office hours are online and uneffective. Spend more time reading the textbook bu yourself and prepare well for exams.
One of my absolute favourite professors, super kind and I found his lectures super interesting!
Great professor.

This prof is very personable and makes learning interesting. I would say that he was more interesting to listen to then many other profs. I think that some of the questions could have been worded better on exams to make it easier to understand.

This man is obsessed with BATS.
Also his 1116 lectures are super great and enthusiastic, if you have trouble keeping focused I highly recommend him, he is great at keeping your attention by making little jokes here and there and it really makes lectures easier to digest.

He is THE BEST prof I have ever had. If you are a biology student or need a science credit I highly recommend taking a course with him. He is funny, super understanding, and his lectures are good. I always find his lectures interesting and as someone that gets distracted easily I always found his lectures keep me entertained. The nicest prof!!

He is a hilarious prof who is very fun to listen to. Lectures are a bit unorganized so devote time to sorting through your notes. However, his tests are not bad so it makes up for the disorganized style.

Dr Willis is a great prof for comp animal phys 2. His tests were very straightforward. He marks a bit tough on the final paper outline but gives good feedback for the final paper! He also had us do a short presentation which was a great way to interact with classmates given the online format. Great lecturer, great guy.

Dr. Willis's class was really interesting! His lectures were very detailed and had lots of examples to help make sense of topics. The exams were really easy but beware of the lab. It's really tough! Overall, I enjoyed taking this course.

Midterm was optional, which was nice at the time, but highly don't recommend skipping it. Makes you write a huge research paper which was graded extremely heavily. Although he gives you feedback, he doesn't give you your marks back until weeeeeks after-- hard to improve when you don't know what to work on. Approachable
His questions for multiple choice were very confusing his word choices were not the best, there is only a midterm and final, be prepared to fully understand material and understand examples.

Lots of boring content in this course but I recommend it because it is pretty easy if you apply yourself. Midterm (10%) was optional, with the marks allocated to the final (25%) for those who chose not to write it. Final was easy if you have a good background in bio. Paper (20%) was graded much more severely but you get feedback from your outline.

Dr. Willis is very knowledgeable in his field and very passionate about his research and ecology in general. His lectures always contain interesting real life examples that make the material memorable.

Dr. Willis is a solid choice for BIOL1116. Does his best to keep lectures interesting with pop culture references, etc. Tests can be quite wordy for multiple choice, but are fair. Slides are detailed enough such that the textbook is not mandatory. Would recommend to anyone taking BIOL1116 who is not able to get Dr. Forbes as their professor.

Willis does his best to make a lot of boring subjects interesting, but he tends to give very monotonous lectures with text-filled slides. He's amazing to learn from about ecology/metabolism, but it's a struggle to stay awake during other topics. Papers take a lot of work, but exams are very fair. Plus, he's the most attractive prof on campus!

This course is going to be tough no matter who you take it with. Willis just reads off his slides that he posts online so going to class isn't mandatory. However, if you do attend class he will periodically give out test questions as a reward for showing up. He will help you if you need it but will not move mountains to do so.

I would highly recommend taking Craig's field course. I took it last summer and it got me super interested in research and field work. He is super enthusiastic and helpful when in the field and gives great feedback and advice for writing papers and giving presentations. It made doing my honours thesis a lot easier.

I took Comprehensive Animal Physiology with Willis. He is a great prof, easy to contact via email, very excited about what he teaches and what does research on. He expects precision writing in essays. Only downside about him is it takes him FOREVER to give stuff back. Also, his Biol-1116 was very easy compared to this one.

Willis is a great guy and he seems respected by others for his research and all that. Stopped going to class because his online notes were good enough and I just read the book after to clarify stuff. Tests are good if you study in advance (course has lots of information). He's awesome! Love this guy, easy on the eyes, there if you need anything.

This is a hard course so if you go into it thinking it isn't, you're not going to do well. Willis had extremely detailed slideshows making using the textbook nearly obsolete. Very nice to look at and listen to because he kept the content interesting. Fair tests, lots of Game of Thrones and The Office references to make you laugh.

The course itself was extremely difficult due to the massive amounts of information that needed to be memorized. He had detailed powerpoint notes that he followed in class. But he went too fast sometimes, covering 5+ chapters in class and then expecting you to know everything because "everything is testable"

I hate this guy. He spent the last lecture on Ecology. The course is called ECOLOGY, Evolution, & Biodiversity. This one class he went through 5 chapters. They are on the exam. His lectures are very boring as he reads right from the power points, so if you don't go to class your not missing much at all. If you have him, escape.
While his notes are a little sparse, he kept lectures interesting with youtube videos and little jokes. Tests are very easy if you read the textbook.
Willis is so enthusiastic about his field of study that it's kind of hard not to get interested in what he's talking about. His lectures are easy to follow, and he's helpful when asked questions.

Professor Willis was an amusing prof, but thats all you learn about. He spends lectures talking about bats and shrews and watching youtube videos and forgets to lecture on the topics. Forgot to do primates and ecology, and his exam is IMPOSSIBLE. Make sure you study examples because every question is based on his examples. Do not miss class

Nice to look at, as said before but lectures are dry and boring as he reads right off the powerpoint. Exam is a big surprise so make sure you have someone in lectures if you don't show up. Read the entire chapters. And he tests you on dumb facts.

What can I say about good ol' Batman? Well he was nice to look at but he basically ruined a bit of biology for me. His class was disappointing when you get a younger prof you expect some interesting spin on material, but there were times when his powerpoints put me straight to sleep. Questions were a little wordy for you average bio test.

Nice to look at - nice guy too! Intro bio class he did not manage time well and spent time talking about stuff not in course outline so no time for ecology (interesting though) think he will improve as this was his first time teaching this course so overall I would say take a class with him if you can - he also does interesting bat research
Smart guy - young and engaged in the subject. Excellent teaching style makes tough material easier to understand. Term paper project may destroy your social life, but you could learn a lot!

Not a bad prof, but only spent half of ONE lecture on ecology, so I guess the course name was a misnomer. Somewhat verbose multiple choice questions. If you want to skip class, just put up a big mirror in front of the stage/lectern.
No Comments

Ok, so first impression is "hot prof, this class will be easy to sit through", then you realize you've just got yourself into a really hard confusing class, and this so called "hot prof" is unhelpful and confusing and refuses to answer your question unless you phrased it in a way he absolutely has to answer, or find an answer to. ARGH!
She was very nice and very helpful, but she can be really dry with her lectures, she has a monotonous voice, but you're also talking about music and the history of music, so it's boring regardless.
Her class is super easy, but I think she's kinda dry which makes it hard for me to pay attention. Otherwise, she's super laid back and you'll have no problem passing her class.
Mrs. Hauser is great! Her tests are pretty easy based on the lectures. She gives bonuses for each test. Solid choice!
Lectures are very boring and hard to pay attention.

Tests come directly from the study guides so if you study those theyre easy 100s, or 102s if you do the bonus. A handful of homework assignments and attendance is taken randomly. Easy A if you put in even the slightest effort.
Shes a really good teacher. Its not boring. Easy to take notes that match perfectly with tests. Homework is easy. Type her notes, a lot easier. Also she has bonuses

Mrs. Hauser is like your favorite teacher from high school - sweet lady but kinda annoying as a professor. Her lectures are pretty boring, but the exams are very easy.  Takes attendance randomly throughout the semester, no extra credit opps, homework assignments due every few weeks, replies to all emails. She just babies her students big time
Awesome teacher! She's super sweet and knows her stuff. This class wasn't that hard, study the slides and take notes and it's an easy A!
An amazing teacher. If you can take her. I enjoyed her class. You will have to study but the tests were not hard. There is a little extra credit but not much.

It is almost impossible to get anything lower than an A in the class if you show up and take notes. She takes attendance every now and then. She does not post her notes online so the only way to get them is to go to class and write them down. However, study the notes you take and an A is so easy to get her tests are word for word from the notes.
Test aren't bad. A few assignments that don't take long. The online test book is required because you have to submit your assignments through it.
Test are not too hard, everything you need to know is on PowerPoints.  Gives study guides and extra credit. She takes attandance randomly. You do not have to be a music major to succeed in her class.

Kristin Hauser wrote her own book for use in class and now buying the book is mandatory. It's really expensive which sucks. She's a very lovely and kind woman who loves what she teaches. The class is an easy A, but keep in mind she makes it very clear that she doesn't round up and an 89.99 is a B. "You get the grade you work for."

Ms. Hauser is by far the easiest music appreciation teacher at Tech. She is super nice and will work with you if you need it. She loves what she teaches and gives you the study guides, that if you study you will make an easy A. Almost no homework. Don't buy the textbook because if you take notes, all her notes answer the study guide questions.
Takes her class way too seriously, but if you go it's an easy A.
If you make anything less than an A then you must be a sociology major cause they are stupid!!  Tests are exactly like her study guide so do that and your golden

Work work work! 5 exams, 5 Online projects, 10 Quizzes,Book you can't resale, notes in class must be written due to that she doesn't list them anywhere else,forcing you to come to class and concert attendance. There are other easy classes with less work. However, she is nice and enjoys her subject; maybe too much!
Easy class.  5 tests worth 10% of your grade each, 50% easy assignments that anyone can make a 100 on.  I never paid attention in class, studied the night before and still made an A with ease.
Hauser is a good professor, and she is really nice. The class is super easy! Just do the assignments and you'll make an A or B.

Professor Hauser is awesome! She tries to make the class interesting and she's pretty funny. She gives two points extra credit on the exams if you take the online quizzes that go with the textbook.  She gives you two free days to miss, but if you miss more, you get a point taken off your final grade. Easy A if you go to class. Take her if you can!

She is awesome!!! She tries to be funny and at times she actually is! Lol but her class is very easy and she's a kind woman!!! Take her! Her tests are easy and you have 3 discussion post which you have a month to get it done and a concert to attend and write 350 words over! Super easy and she makes it fun with listenings and videos!!! Loved her!

I will definitely miss this instructor. She was brilliant and not simply because the class wasn't terribly  difficult. She reminds me of that favorite elementary school teacher we all have had. There isn't much use for the text book as the class is pretty well dominated by power points. Take notes and read every email. You will score well.
Easy A! The class (Music Appreciation) was pretty interesting, and there is no homework. Look over your study guides before the test and you'll have no trouble. Attendance is mandatory.

The class was easy. I made overall great grades.  However, it's incredibly boring.  AND, she takes attendance every class period. This may not seem like an issue, but you are only allowed to miss 2 classes and it's a 3 day a week class. Also, I made an 89.7% in the class,and I still did NOT get  an A like other professors do.

I study for about 20 minutes before every exam and have not gotten lower than a 90 on one. This class couldn't be any easier. If you can't at least get a B, it is your own fault. Easy easy easy easy A.

Easy class if you take your notes and study some.  Powerpoints make note-taking easy, and listening excercises aren't too difficult either.  As long as you take the notes and write down the song names, you really shouldn't waste your money getting the text book.  Takes attendance randomly, so don't skip too often.

She teaches almost everything you need to know for the tests with her Powerpoints, which saves you time with some of the reading. Listening portion should be studied by yourself online. You need to go to 1 concert (on campus) to write a review. Extra credit is the online assignment (hard to accomplish if you don't read). She's a very nice person.

Mrs. Hauser really knows her stuff. Teaches power-point. Gives study guides for tests. If you study the guides good then you will do just fine on the tests. Only had to attend 1 concert event and write a 1 page paper. NO FINAL. Just a regular last test.

She is a hoot and loves to teach this class.  Tests are easy and you get extra credit on your exams for doing online quizzes.  3 Online Discussions. Concert review. Study guides provided.  Easy A, which is what everyone wants. :)

Very nice. 5 tests, she provides a study guide for each. 3 online discussion assignments. you are required to attend a concert and do a review. test aren't easy but they're not hard either. you need to study. attendance is mandatory. I would recommend her. Good teacher!
It was my favorite class. Not hard whatsoever. Shes really nice.

She is a very nice woman who goes out of her way to help you. Her test a very easy. She requires you to attend concerts outside of class that a worth 20 perscent of your class I was unable to do this so I had to drop. She is easy and test are easy. It just little thing abot the class that is troubling.

She is a good professor. She loves the Beatles and she reminds you of that fact almost everyday. But her grading system sucks. It's relatively fair up until you get to the final grade. I literally missed getting a B in her course by 0.1. So if you are hoping she curves or rounds up, she doesn't. Other than that she gives lots of musical examples.

Notes everyday on powerpoint slides can make this class seem long and boring, but if you write down the things from the powerpoint and study them you will do well on the tests.Easy A if you put effort into studying (don't really even need book)
Most boring class ever, but if you go and take notes it's the easiest A.

mrs. hauser is a fantastic teacher. she is always helpful and very nice! i made an A+ in her class. she tells you exactly what to write down. she will work with you if you don't understand it. she is always trying to make the class fun. the tests are EASY! she really likes what she teaches and i enjoyed her class so much!
Very good teacher. She makes the subject as interesting as classical music can be. Gives a study guide for each test telling you the exact questions.Show up take notes, you'll be fine.

Easy class. She makes it fun. Show up, take notes, and study a little for exams and you'll do well. 5 online quizzes taken in first two weeks of class worth 10% of grade. Two concerts worth 20%. Three exams and a final make up the rest.

this lady is so corny but she is so nice that you have to laugh with her...such an easy class! all u do is take the notes from the powerpoint slides and study them using her study guides. very easy A, and most of the music isnt too bad. take her!!!!
Extremely easy class. I made a 100 on every test. Take notes and listen to the boring music make your A and be done with it. If you are looking for an A take her.
Piece of cake. Music Appreciation Exams come STRAIGHT from the study guide.

This is no longer an easy class. I have been everyday and taken notes and studied like crazy for test! That is not enough!!! Half the stuff you take notes over is not on the test. Several things she ask you can find in the book only. You must read the book and study the notes very thoroughly to pass. You never know what she is looking for!

Attendance is mandatory. She gave us 3 absences but after that she started counting off our grade. You have to see 2 concerts wich isn't too big a deal. Tests are pretty much straight from her lectures so as long as you go to class and put a little effort into studying your notes the night before you should do fine in this class.

Her class is really, really boring, but it's an easy A.  She gives you a study guide with everything you need to know before each test.  I don't think this class could possibly be any easier, but it's just soooooooo boring!!
Really easy class all u need to do is show up for class bc attendance is mandatory and study the powerpoint notes she gives u and u will do fine.

This professor is awesome.  Tests are straight out of the notes, no curve balls, and the music is all fairly easy to identify.  Even makes comments that are relevant and funny.  Take if at all possible.

If you can't pass this class, then you probably either a) didn't show up, or b) didn't take notes. all of her tests are straight from her notes. so pretty much, if you don't make an A, you must be an idiot.
She is really nice, and very easy. Go to class because attendance will make a difference in your grade. Tests are straight from the notes. I would highly recommend her!

Very easy teacher. Go to class she takes attendance some which is part of the final grade. Write down what the power points say and look over it a couple of hours before the tests. There is no suprises on the tests it all comes from the notes. Only used the book to listen to the music not to read from.
Having music appreciation with her was a breeze. She is very clear and even gives study guides.

Best teacher I had at tech, and Im a computer engineer with no musical background. She was very clear with what she was saying and most of the subject was very intresting. Tests are extremely easy, and the 3 concerts worksheets you have to complete are also very easy. If you are taking Music appreciation, I highly recommend that you take her!
Super easy class!! All you have to do is copy down the powerpoints slides and study those. She's funny and nice. Makes class interesting. Takes random attendance. Easy A

TAKE HER IF YOU CAN! You won't regret it. Take notes, study, and you'll do fine. She really tries to make this class easy for someone like me who knew absolutely nothing about music. Tests aren't bad either.
I really liked her class.  She tried to make it interesting.  She basically tells you what is going to be on the test, but the tests are usually very detailed.  Just study the notes and it's fine.

overall she is a good teacher.. im a jock and always have been, but she done her best to be as helpful as possible.. her tests are a lot harder than they need to be.. she is really picky but if you look over your notes a few nights prior then youll be fine..

She is very nice but she makes the test a little harder than they have to be.  If you enjoy opera and things of that nature you'll love it.  She does make some pretty boring stuff decently interesting.  Not an easy A though.  I have better grades in my upper level math classes! lol

She is an awesome teacher! I dont like learning about music at all but she made it very very easy and interesting!! She tells you exactly whats on the tests and she is really helpful about the concerts!! Easy A!!!
Easy class overall.  Explains well but you still have to study well for tests if you want an A.

she is really easy..the only thing bad is tryin to pay attention in class. her notes are real easy but her lectures are real boring. It's an easy A ans her tests are pretty easy..juss study the notes.
She's very nice and helpful. The class is pretty easy, I particularly like how she does the concert reports. She really cares about her students, I would definitely take her again.

Fairly easy, no papers rocked.  Didn't ever even listen to the cd's except in class, and got a B.  Do the concerts, go to class, brush up on the notes right  before exams and you'll get a B, maybe an A if your memory is better than mine
This class is easy as crap.  Unless you are retarded you will get a least a B.
She is the best teacher for this class! The notes are exctly whats on the test. Easy listening quizzes! No papers for concerts unlike other teachers. Easy A!

This class is really easy. Go to class or get then notes from a friend, study the material and you'll make an A. It is really boreing, but I don't know how you could make classical music interesting anyways. She trys anway.

Easy as****.  She makes it very clear at the beginning of the semester when the quizzes and tests will be, so a lot of people only show up on those days.  I show up every time because some people in other classes communicate with me via the grafitti on the desk.  I take notes, but I don't know why I bother... just skim the chapters before the test and listen to the music the night before the listening quizzes.  She also has a lame sense of humor wich I think is awesome in a teacher.

This class is moderately interesting. Many of the style periods get boring but she does her best to make them interesting. Now if they can just get her husband to start teaching the history of rock and roll again we'll be in business.
You take way to many notes!If you do not study pretty well for her tests.. you will not make an A! She is a really nice teacher, and is helpful if you just go and talk to her!
Wonderful, caring teacher.  Study notes and go to concerts to make an easy A.  Actually it is impossible to make lower than a B if you study.  Fall students--Halloween concert is awesome!
Pretty easy class. You take a BUNCH of notes and its kind of boring but that's it. She is really nice and real helpful. She makes it where its about impossible to fail.
Much harder than I expected...but go to class for your 10% attendence, go to concerts for 10%...and study your study guides, more work than i thought, but an easy B or A if you apply yourself.
She is really nice. She takes attendance, but its worth showing up to take the notes. Gives study guides for the quizzes and tests. Just study from time-to-time and you should pull out an "A".
Class is very easy. I had no music backgroud and managed to make an A. She gives lots of notes and study guides. She is very nice and willing to help if you ask!!
She's a good teacher. Should be an easy A if you take notes and study.
She is a nice teacher. Lots of note taking. Tests are not too bad if you study.
Ok class, a lot of note taking.  Test are hard if you don't study.  Listening quizes are pretty easy if you have listened to the required pieces.
She is a very nice teacher. Lots of note taking. Tests are not too bad.
Good class if you ask questions.

Great teacher. He values safety and careful detailed work. When in his class he is consistently making jokes and always makes students feel welcome. With a hands on activity every week, Professor Kang's class is labor intensive; but worth it. Only negative side is there are not a lot of opportunities for graded material; so all work must be perfect
a great course that taught me a lot of skills

She cares deeply about her students success and will go above and beyond to help. She's also lenient when she comes to grading. However, the course was very scattered and hard to follow. Her projects weren't too bad themselves, but the submission instructions for them were way harder than they needed to be

Wonderful professor. This class was taught online, and she found time to answer every single question in a very short time. All office hours were recorded and posted. She's incredibly organized and really wants students to understand. This may have been the best course I took in the entire Master's program.
A great professor!

Feng Liang taught one section in conjunction with two other sections.  There was shared material between these different sections and common exams.  However Professor Liang took the time to make her own slides, which eventually other students in the other sections asked to start using because they were so helpful.
There is a strange distribution of grades in stat 410, there is a subset of people with get very, very high As and a subset of people who struggle.

Professor Liang taught the graduate section and had all her PowerPoint notes and relevant code accessible online.  Her notes were very succinct and she would use class time to go through the dense mathematical/statistical methods to prove/calculate/better understand the results on her notes.  All her exams/homeworks were based off her notes/code.

It's a joy for my life to know such an EXTREMELY smart and nice professor. She is also a very easy grader as long as you work reasonably hard (more than 80% of the class get at least A-) and respect her.

For graduate classes, the assignment schedule has been fairly sporadic (the number of overall homework  assignments changes throughout the semester).  Grading is somewhat slow, and the professor appears disorganized in this regard.  One semester, I didn't get my grade until a month after the semester ended.

I knew right away that I was going to struggle with this professor. I've dealt with bad language barriers before and this was no different. The problem was I was already barely passing this class before the unit assigned to this professor (this is a team taught course) and her poorly explained lectures were no help when attempting to keep my C.

The course is very disorganized. The things in the homework are not explained in class, so if you take this course, you'll have to study everything by yourself. A strong background in R is required, since she doesn't teach it but the level of programming in hw is quite hard (esp. when you have to study the whole concepts at the same time).
Prof Liang is cute, however, her class is confusing.

Unfortunately Prof Liang does not seem well prepared for class.  I don't think she has a lesson plan going into the class.  She comes derives some proofs on the black board, but has no course notes prepared.  She also does not teach any concept, so be prepared to teach those to yourself.  Avoid unless you already know the material.

Prof Liang is very nice, and she is happy to see students doing well. Her exams are quite fair, though the homework is a little bit challenging somtimes. If you can finish the homework by yourself, then the exam won't be a problem at all.

I did not like this class at all.  It was heavily based on theory while the homework was based on applications.  Basically, this class was all over the place.  There were days where we went through maybe two derivations in the entire class period, none of which were helpful for the homework or exams.  Professor Liang was nice, though.
Good researcher, bad professor.

The lectures were mostly her reading from slides with minimal explanation for some topics and over-explaining for others. Homework and exam expectations were often unclear and both were graded very specifically, with no room for minimal mistakes or even a slight lack of detail. Very disappointing class and a deeply unpleasant experience.

Oh wow, what should I say about this??? It's rare to see a professor who is so underprepared for the class. I'm quite speechless actually. She would blur through important and new concept but spend 10 minutes explaining what does "True Positive" mean. It's a shame she's teaching data mining, which is a subject I was really excited to learn about.

Lewis teaches the class well but for some parts I feel the lectures could be improved upon. One 2 hour lecture causes people to lose attention compared to 2, 1 hour lectures. Homework and labs and textbook are good but the key to success is doing countless practice exams as they are as similar as can be to the real exams.

She's an overall good person and a respectful teacher but this is a very test-heavy class. Lectures are long and boring and labs are not very helpful. You really have to put in the time to learn everything on your own if you want a good grade in the class.

This class is terrible. Professor Lewis seems like a nice person and she is enthusiastic about coding, but not a good teacher. Lectures and labs are useless for the most part. Most of your grade comes from the tests so take  practice tests. I also emailed Professor Lewis a couple times with no response, which I thought was unprofessional and rude.
Very bubbly and outgoing in lectures. Makes the long lecture more interesting.

No coding background here. The class isn't bad but it is self taught, most of what you learn is on zybooks. the practice exams are essential, doing multiple practice exams are key to doing well in this course. Lectures and Labs are long and inefficient. 4 exams, 4 quizzes, and a final is annoying, some T/F questions are curveballs,do practice exams

The course is mainly a self-teaching structure, so majority of what you learn depends on you. Lecture is once a week for review of what you learned. Colleen was alright, didn't really see her much. The TA's were great for the course. I did well and had zero background in CS.

The class was pretty hard if you have no background in coding. However, Colleen is really nice and I enjoyed her energy and passion for the subject. I struggled a bit with this class but I would take her again.
This professor will state that she cares in the beginning of the course and right after that don't expect anything, especially if you're coming from high school.

Lecture and lab attendance were required but you learn nothing and it's basically a waste of time. People just go for clickers. She walks around during lecture and uses paper to smack people's shoulders/heads if they're not doing CS.

Lectures are useless for explaining things. Tests are difficult as they will have a lot of questions where one wrong type and its wrong and you lose a lot of points. Also a lot of random question that we never go over in class. Course goes to fast through the material as well. Class needs to be fixed

the lectures were useless in understanding the material so I just went for iclickers. She comes down from the stage and taps students on the shoulders if their laptop screen is not CS stuff but it was annoying since attendance was required and no one wanted to be there. The practice exams were helpful tho, they were literally the actual test

Although she had high energy during class times, the way she explained concepts to the students was poor and hard to follow. The way this class is structured is not efficient, unorganized, and this professor does not help in alleviating this mess.
While this professor had introduced me to the world of Computer Science, I believe that this professor could do a MUCH better job at helping students. Course needs revision!

Of the two main instructors who have contributed to CS124, easily the superior of the two. She makes complicated topics easy to understand, simplifying them down into bits that are easier for the brain to digest. A great teacher overall.
Colleen is amazing. Enough said.
The professor did pretty well in visualizing abstract concepts, absolutely perfect for beginners.

I took CS 374 on 23 Spring and asked questions very often. He is nice and patient to answer questions. The lecture is clear and exam is not that difficult as I imagined before. I cannot get an A without him :D
the goat
one of the best professors I've ever met. I love his lecture.

GREAT lectures, made everything easy to understand despite being one of the most difficult CS classes. imo the tests were very reasonable (especially since you get plenty of time) as long as you understand the HW/lectures
Chandra is super cool. His class is pretty difficult, but fun with his humor.
THIS IS LITERALLY THE F**KING BEST PROF I'VE EVER MET

Chandra's lectures are dense, but he makes an effort of being comprehensive in covering material. His presentation structure is good. He isn't particularly funny or inspiring, but he gets the job done and makes you feel like you learned -something- after each lecture.

CS374 is the hardest class in the CS curriculum, so the 3 in difficulty is a relative score compared to the other instructors in the class. The exams make up the vast majority of the grade in the class, but 20% of the grade is HW and you're allowed a group of 3. My biggest piece of advice for future students is to come into this class with a group
Doesn't make lectures very exciting.

He did a great job teaching a notoriously difficult course. He is passionate, thorough, and knowledgeable. Assisted by a great course staff, he made algorithms a fun, memorable, and fruitful experience.

Williams is a great math teacher and a very kind woman. Class is somewhat fast paced & if you don't go you will fall behind. Williams is very good at explaining & teaching but the material can still get difficult. She does offer extra help outside of class in a few different ways. You will need basic math knowledge. Do homework and practice tests.
doesn’t answer emails

Ms. Williams is nice, however I would only recommend taking her if you're good at math, because her class is fast paced. She's very helpful, and will even give you extra help during her office hours. Unfortunately this wasn't enough to help me get my grade to a c, but overall she's an amazing professor :)

Professor Williams is a great professor to have! Her lectures are straightforward and understandable. The assignments are pretty easy and are usually due in a week. She offers extra credit by completing quizzes. Tests are easy especially since she goes over the type of questions that will be on tests and gives out formula sheets.

hw and quizzes are done outside of class and you have a week to do both which is nice & You can retake quizzes over and over. She holds optional class before test which covers everything on it. If you go, you will pass as long as you pay attention. She does go very fast. If you apply yourself and get help when you need it you will be fine.

If you are not good at math, don't take her. She's a sweet woman, but she doesn't teach the material well. She moves very fast and class is always held till the last second. If you are good at math, an A is possible if you do all the homework. The homework is what helped me pass the tests, not her lecturing. There's about 3 hw assignments a week.

Ms. Williams was super sweet and I knew she cares if you pass or not! I wanted to take her for another math class but my schedule didn't work out:) She is super sweet and approachable and very helpful if you need it! Highly Recommend!

If you are not strong at math dont take her class. She doesnt really work with you, She will just tell you to go to the math building for tutoring or the math center. Her teaching style is very fast paced and her tests are online you wont get partial credit. I had to hire my own private tutor just to get through this class. Would not recommend.

Individual study research with prof for two semester (with and without credits). Great mentor. Weekly reading papers and discussion. I was able to publish a paper afterwards. Great learning experience.

Took this class in summer 2023. Very well organized class. The lectures were accessible and easy to follow. Machine problems were well useful exercises to practice the concepts taught and they were well guided. The teaching staff (TA and CA) were super helpful.

Did research (individual study) with the prof over two semesters. He met with students in small groups weekly. I learned how to use google scholar to find and read papers-- and there was a lot of reading. Weekly discussion helped to brainstorm ideas and design solutions. Very helpful experience to learn about research for applying to grad school.

The class was well organized and well paced. Lectures were clear, easy to follow, and helpful for learning the materials. A series of machine problems and the final project combined to give hand-on, step by step practical experience. A great class for learning databases.

I had the same experience doing research with Prof. Chang as several other students here. I put my best foot forward and Prof. Chang consistently gave me positive feedback weekly, telling me to "keep up the good work". Come the end of the summer, he gives me a C with ridiculous reasoning. Brought the case to the dean to get this grade off my record
Everything goes well during semester and good feedback for final report. Got a C with ridiculous reasons, never join him for research or loR!

The class was well organized and structured. Professor Chang was great at explaining the concepts and reviewed all the homework questions during office hour every week. Additionally, he was consistently active on the forum to answer questions. The MPs and final project were well designed for learning and the grading was generous.

He came up with the ideas for the final project during the middle of the semester. His feedback is vague and clueless. For instance, when you ask "what does XXX means in the paper", he will be "you should read the paper again". When you ask "what does assignment X mean" he will be "Didn't you listen my class?". AVOID HIM AT ANY COST.

Useful material. Class is well-structured. Lectures are clear and easy to follow. Much weight on semester project. Three small quiz exams and a final exam. Workload was heavier than other online courses I took.

He gave good lectures, well prepared, clear, and organized. The exam questions were based on assignment quiz questions but seemed much harder. I learned useful stuff, especially from the project work. Grading was fair. He actually listened to the class and changed final exam weights. Liked his class.

I think Professor Chang enjoys failing his students. His exams are so tricky and unnecessarily difficult. Also, his lectures are confusing and his explanations aren't solid. Very frustrating. Wish I took this course with another prof.

Horrible quality of the online lectures for his course. Ideas are not clearly explained and his jokes and generally the way of presenting content are rather irritating. Exams have lots of tricky questions which don't test your understanding of the subject but maybe your attention to details.

Plays little filthy tricks like a fool as said below. Never take a LoR from him. Very poor at giving feedback and high communication barriers. When asking for feedback he's very vague and cannot explain himself. He said I did a good job and gave me a C-. You can tell what the quality of his research is from the lack of grad students in his groups!
Be careful! Never ask him for a recommendation letter! He is good at writing a 'black recommendation letter'! The most ridiculous person I have ever seen!

He is a treacherous person. He is very good at playing little filthy tricks like a fool. He is a shame for the CS department. Should be fired. He is notorious and no one wants to do research with him. It's so funny that he needs to send out spam ads to incoming grads to recruit for his lab!
The best professor ever. Great (video) lectures. Really caring and understanding.

He is very irresponsible to his course and his students. He always changes his course schedule and posts some weird assignments. Instructions were not clear, and exams were even worse. He didn't test your understanding of the material. Instead, he tested you on materials that he didn't taught. Definitely worst professor ever

Tough class, but perhaps the best one I have in college/grad school. Professor taught critical thinking and emphasized concepts. Questions discussed in class were intriguing and inspiring. Much reading. Heavy project. I would recommend!
Helpful and interesting lectures. Homework was heavy, but TA turptorials helped a lot. Generous grading with lots extra credits.

He is funny but he does not teach well. I will recommend that instead of going through quickly from slides better explain the concept and show how can you apply the concept to a small problem.  You are at your own to figure out stuff

The materials were hard and he went through it way too fast. Homeworks took a lot of time, but you could get some help by attending the tutorial and the TA office hours. Exams were very tough, you would have to understand each concept to do well. If you take it as 3 credits, make sure to do the extra-credit project to boost your grade.
Lectures are clear and interesting. Best I have this semester.
Am taking it right now. Great teacher.
Explained things clearly with good examples. Lectures were recorded. Exams were reasonable. Hard stuff made easy!
GREAT PROFESSOR!
I like this course, which is practical and actually fun. He is a good teacher and give good lectures. Homework was reasonable. Exams could be hard.
Good lectures. Actually enjoyed listening to him. I'd take his course again too, maybe 412.
Bad teacher.  The class was way too hard this semester.  I would suggest waiting for a different professor for 411.
He taught well. His lecture was clear and sometimes quite humorous. The project was long but doable. Midterm exam was harder than final.

Did a great job of making a somewhat dull subject less dull. He has a 5-10 minute intermission halfway through class to let student stretch or go to the bathroom which was awesome. Taking another of his classes next semester!

Am currently taking it. Great prof. He made database interesting to learn about. Lectures were clear and fun, and homeworks were well prepared with a reasonable amount of work. The project is going to be due soon, but I learned a lot in it.
Good prof. Knew the stuff well. Quiz three times in class. Lectures were long. Project was fun.
Good humored and patient. Sometimes a little difficult to understand (not too often). I liked intermissions during lectures.
Great teacher. Lectures were long but fun. Made students go to classes. Homeworks were hard. 2 MPs really took time. Learned a lot.

Took it in fall 2014, and was a great experience. Orof was very interestred in our learning well. He was always prepared for the lectures, and his lectures were clear, and his humor made a long lecture enjoyable-- but the 75 minutes lecture could still be too long. The assignments were a little buggy at first. The practice questions were helpful!

His ability to explain and use relevant examples was amazinng. It even allowed my mother (who did not attend college and did not know computer stuff) to follow along and understand a few lectures when I watched over at home during the thanksgiving break. He made this field incredibly accessible.

Tests were wayyyyyyy too hard and he doesn't curve the class and doesn't compare undergrad and grad grades. Pretty sure undergraduate's have a terrible average compared to the grad students in this class.
Do not take CS412, this is useless course.  In class quiz is random and I hate the policy.  Homework is boring so as lectures.

The workload is pretty heavy, but only after finishing all the work will you realize how useful they are in the future. It teaches you not only the knowledge, but also things that are more important. I spent A LOT of time on this course, and saw a significant improvement in myability of solving problem and presentation skill.
The course is useless. Lectures are boring. Extremely heavy workload. One project, one paper survey + presentation, 4 homework and one exam which only counts for 10 points. Never take it!!

Terrible lectures. Prof Chang had a strong asian accent and an obsession with including beer in every lecture. In fact, he told us to watched the coursera videos on databases. The homeworks were poorly written and graded extremely slowly. Exams were entirely memorization based.

Amazing. The class was very interesting and talked about different concepts of graph mining.
He was very prepared and he was really smart. Once it turned out students didn't do well in the midterm, he allowed a resubmission to the midterm and took the final very easily.
Also has HWs and group projects which were nontrivial.
Overall very interesting

Not sure if it's due to online classes or not, but probably one of the worst classes I've ever taken. Lectures are just professor reading off the slides, homework is very vague, and office hours hardly helped, so pretty much you're 100% on your own. Interesting material, just bad execution.

She is an extremely knowledgeable professor that explains the concepts very well. However, she is a little bit unprofessional when it comes to grading the homeworks and tests, as well as the class as a whole. Refuses to release cutoffs, and the tests focus more on tricks than the actual content. Still a great class, and an extremely useful one!

Really good professor. Every concept is explained very well and the tests and homework really make sure you understand the concepts well. Class isn't easy but def interesting. Highly recommend taking it with this professor

Lectures weren't great and I opted to watch Indy Gupta's for most of the material instead. She sometimes doesn't explain things clearly, but some of it might be due to online class and not being able to tell when students are confused. But overall, the class structure and grading was fair and workload was light for a 400-level class.

The slides are barely covered in the lectures, and you will instead listen to his "philosophy" that are NOT EVEN CLOSE to the topic. Can confirm he got mad at a student during the mid-term presentation. I hope the class will improve over time, otherwise your time can be better spent than staying in this class.

He assigns midterm presentations that have very little guidance and ambiguous rubrics. He expects these presentations to be better than his own lectures, which are lacking, as the only memorable parts of his lectures are the tangents he goes on. He gives no help on what to add to presentations, but gets mad if we skip the smallest topics.
Just ridiculous teaching and ambiguous requirements / syllabus
He's basically the one who discovered and developed all the material taught in the class. He can ramble in lectures. Homeworks and labs help teach the material.

The entire material of the class could have been taught in 3-4 weeks. Unfortunately, he would spend a lot of time talking about lots of unrelated things and stories. HWs and assignments in the lab were not exactly related to lectures. I would not recommend the class and the prof.

Prof. Sha is the guy who pioneered the field real-time systems. No doubt He knows everything and has vision. The course is packed with topics with the assumption that you MUST research about them after class.  Don't miss classes. Read the books.  If you want to be a real engineer, take it and survive it! OS knowledge is an absolute prerequisite.

I was really interested in taking a course on embedded systems. I signed up for this class but what can I say! He is the worst professor I have ever had (in term of teaching not personality to be fair). He doesn't teach, he just show up, try to be funny, and leave. Concepts are not defined or explained in organized way. This course really sucks.

Terrible lecturer, you're better of reading the slides. He's a nice guy but it takes more than that to be a half decent professor. I can't believe the CS department keeps this guy on. The class itself is pretty bad too but that's a different matter.
Quite literally the worst professor I've ever had.
His cs class is like philosophy

The worst professor I have ever had BY FAR puts on a likeable persona but is evil, monthly lectures = no info, TA's Suck. doesnt give accommodation to students even for death. He refused to let me take course my mandatory term because "its not online" but other students took it online, holds grudges. just a stuck up power hungry professor, STAYAWAY
